0x31752f158e3b7535:0x4c0b9192b23f798d.comment: I ordered a Tiger sugar pearl milk tea today by pointing at what I wanted on the menu and clarifying what it was using google translate from English to Vietnamese. I have had many milk teas and this one was the worst one I‚Äôve ever had. It tasted like sugar water and didn‚Äôt have many pearls in it. I went back and explained that there is no milk in the milk tea that I ordered and they said that it is powdered milk (which I still struggle to believe as it looked and tasted like water with sugar) and there is a different one on the menu that has real milk in it priced slightly higher. I said that what they gave me is not what I ordered. The staff made no attempt to correct the issue only saying that next time I should get a different one. I won‚Äôt be going back again. That is not how you do customer service.

Bought two cones. Ice cream itself was very grainy. Not good.
One of the cones was broken so ice cream leaked out. They tried to cover it up by putting extra napkins over it. Only noticed it a few minutes later when we had already left with the food.

Sign outside said cone for 8, while price on menu was 10. Make up your minds.

Don't waste your time here. Just go to McDonald's or KFC close by if you want a cheap cone.

While trying to order, I tried to ask the staff to clarify something about the drinks to me. Out of 6 people working there, 0 were speaking english. I know that I am just a visitor in Vietnam, however, I assumed that they know at least colors.

They were not capable of answering whether it is black or green tea.

The drink itself was not good at all. Even though I had 0% of sugar, it was still really sweet.

should try the traditional milk tea
staff are nice but quite slow
no separated area for delivery with order than 10 paxes usually, then though I came when shop is not crowded, it took me 30 min to take my just 2 milk tea away
We had to wait a while to order, but the bubble tea was tasty.

Too much ice for my kungfu oolong tea. All the pearls were trapped underneath. Long wait.

Place is nice. Music too loud.
Pudding Milk tea was bad, the milk tasted odd. pudding was overly sweet and tasted like it‚Äôs been there for a long time.
Good drink (but not too special). Good price (only when you have deal off). And good view too. I love milkfoam of Toco.

6.-  A lot of Grab people pass by to pick Up food from here, so, It must be good!!

Overall, the drinks are ok, not very sweet but if you are a fan of strong tea flavor, this one is not the best choice. The taste is quite creamy of milk. The cacao boba is normal, I do not recommend it.

The price is around > 70k/ one + topping.

The minus thing here is the WC is located in the next building. It's an officer so all the light is turned off, only the way you go to the WC. Very inconvenient and quite dangerous (personal opinion)

Shop is nicely designed with proper lighting. It is a little small,located on a busy street. So it‚Äôs very nice sitting inside and enjoy a great cup of healthy milk tea while watching vehicles passing by. I tried oolong tea almond milk with chocolate bubbles. I think it was a decent drink. I should have skipped the choco bubbles. 2 things to mention: 1. staff should be more friendly and attentive 2. The menu should be simplified a bit
I got the chocolate banana with cashew and banana boba and it was one of the best drinks I have ever had. I highly recommend

0x31752ee44664537f:0x537a0aaf58bfed42.comment: The milk tea is okay for the price. The owners are very nice. The line is very long every day haha. This is a really local local milk tea place
The flavor is very close to Taiwan Milk tea. And it is not very expensive and affordable. Cheers!

This Taiwanese milk tea shop always has a long line.
You have to wait 5-15 minutes before you can buy a drink.
The taste is on par with trendy milk tea chains, but the price is less than half that, which is why it's so popular.
If you find waiting boring, you should go to a chain shop.
Take out tapioca milk tea with very good price, a lot of options to choose. Good taste but quite weak tea flavour.
Worth to wait 10 minutes for a cup of Taiwan Milktea. Kind of the best, in the low price segment.
Super Nice, let's wait in line !!! If you get luck it takes you 15 mins stand in line.

Store is only one seller ~ it may be characterised of this store. So this store is not apply for one person (because boss will remind if you let your motorbike near store so crowd - police can come to remind ^^) or you need a quickly to buy and move :)
However, if you like to discovery with people you can book order by App or stand in line and wait to buy :) after wait near 20 minutes, finally come me :), i may understand reason why store crowd because the boss of store is happy, and price is not high ~ this is one of the store of Milk tea the first of Saigon :)
The weather is hot but you havd to stand in lind out store (only take a way) so it really hot on this days so i just let it 3 with atmosphere :) although people is crowd ^^
Hope i have time and patient to back and stand in line to wait and buy again ^^ this is a good memories to me ^^
Super long line and drink was average. Takeout only.

This milk tea shop offers a nostalgic taste of childhood. The tea has a gentle yet fragrant flavour, perfect for those who prefer a subtler taste. Take-out only, the shop is staffed by a friendly and professional team who are deaf. When you pull up on your motorcycle, they will greet you with a menu, notepad, and pen. Simply choose your drink, write it down, and send it back. They will let you know the price while preparing your order, and accept both cash and bank transfers.

While the ordering process might seem unfamiliar at first, especially for new customers, the staff's meticulous preparation ensures every drink is a delicious experience. Do not hesitate to give it a try.

This bubble tea caf√© is a true gem for anyone craving a taste of nostalgia. The flavors take you back to the classic bubble tea experience, with rich, authentic options that remind you of how bubble tea used to be. Their original selections are a refreshing break from trendy spins, staying true to the timeless taste that bubble tea lovers grew up with. If you‚Äôre looking for that nostalgic sip, this is the place to be!

A little second-generation milk tea shop.

The second-generation owner is hard of hearing and has two deaf employees, so when you go there, please write out your order (unless you know sign language üôÇüôÉ).

There is one price whether you order the medium or the large size. They make the tea themselves; the toppings they buy ready-made.

They have a selection of drinks which are no sugar (‚Äòkh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ªùng‚Äô) and another selection which are low sugar (‚Äò√≠t ƒë∆∞·ªùng‚Äô). Ask them which drinks these are, as the menu does not indicate that clearly.

Very limited seating and motorbike parking, so customers are almost exclusively takeout; you can sit on your bike and they will bring out an umbrella for you (for both rain and sun protection) and take your order.

Everyone is very friendly and prompt with the orders.
It may not be the best and comfy one, but the quality is unmatched so far imo
It's good but I wish they have soy milk or oat milk options
Should try once if you wanna try the childhood milk tea taste ü´°

We were recommended by a local to try this place out because we haven‚Äôt had broken rice for a long time and really missed it a lot. This place truly did not disappoint ü§©

The food was very simple but really hearty and they taught us how to make the sauce for the meal to be more enjoyable ü•π if they didn‚Äôt teach us about the sauce, we‚Äôd have just eaten the dish on its own - the simple sauce truly elevated the dish.

Really glad to have tried this place and we would be back.

If you want to try authentic broken rice with good quality of food, try this one. I'm a big fan of "C∆°m T·∫•m" and i love the flavor of every dishes of this restaurant. Home-made, owner is so friendly and kind üòä

If you‚Äôre craving authentic Vietnamese flavors, C∆°m T·∫•m @ 2 S√ÄI G√íN is a spot you shouldn‚Äôt miss.

Special Bacon Grill was so juicy and tasty can‚Äôt miss‚ú®üôèüèª

Amazing people, with an amazing 11 year old boy who serves/speaks English like a native. Definitely no problem getting food here. Besides that, food was amazing and very beautifully presented. Props to the Dad on the grill. He knows what he is doing!!!

It was so good. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly. I had so much fun with my beloved wife and simply saying, must try place for sure. I wish they gave bigger portions but for the price we are paying it is understanding and we still loved it cause we went to other places to try as well.
Delicious food and drinks! The meat was just right and marinated perfect! The owner was also very friendly, loved the service and the overall atmosphere
very accommodating when I mentioned I couldn‚Äôt eat pork and came by a few times to give us extra sauce and toppings!

Not sure why this place has a 4.9 rating. I had pork skin and egg loaf. They were surprised that I didn't have pork chop. The pork skin didn't have much ground rice in it and the egg loaf was not firm. Iced tea and wet towel were free. Staff was very friendly.

0x31752f3971e314ef:0x78138e2fe4e745dd.comment: This has to be THE BEST place in Ho Chi Minh City for com tam. The food is insanely delicious. The pork is savoury yet sweet, marinated perfectly. All the ingredients are locally sourced from the Mekong Delta and you can really taste the quality of the ingredients. We tried a number of different dishes, all amazing. Definitely a place worth visiting in Saigon. Check out our channel for a full review of our experience: Hungry Two Travel.

Our first time trying c∆°m t·∫•m (‚Äúbroken rice‚Äù) and it was excellent! I had the signature style with a soft drink for less than $100,000 VND! The restaurant was tucked down a side street and was an authentic experience with many locals enjoying the food which is cooked freshly outside. The service was exceptional and food brought out quickly. Highly recommended for authentic Vietnamese c∆°m t·∫•m!

I recently visited a cozy com tam suon cha shop, and it was a delightful experience! The broken rice was perfectly cooked, with a satisfying texture that paired wonderfully with the tender, flavorful grilled pork chop. The cha (egg meatloaf) was rich and savory, adding a nice balance to the dish. The accompanying fish sauce was tangy and well-seasoned, elevating every bite. The shop had a welcoming vibe, with quick service and affordable prices. Highly recommend it for a quick, authentic Vietnamese meal!

The local street foods to be recommended.

Location next to university.

Various food selection for pork lover.
With the great sweetened fishsouce

If you‚Äôre craving **authentic Vietnamese comfort food**, this C∆°m T·∫•m is a **must-try**. It‚Äôs hearty, flavorful, and utterly satisfying. Pair it with an **iced jasmine tea (tr√† ƒë√°)** for the full experience.

This is probably the best Com Tam I've had in Saigon. The chop is large, very meaty and nicely seasoned and grilled. The trung hep served with it is thick and full of mushrooms. I ordered the dac biet and the portion size was very good.  This isn't the cheapest com tam around but the food is excellent.

Great and amazing place to have breakfast. It‚Äôs not expensive and the service is really good. We had rice with egg and pork chop/sausage. It lacked a bit of salt, but you can easily do that by yourself.

Definitely cheap and good lunch option, very crowded with office people during lunch hour and I supposed this is so popular; i finished the whole bowl of com tam being a tourist!l (and i added a fried egg)

Stuffed bitter gourd soup was great too!

0x31752f74b75f363d:0xe703a1c7463f268e.comment:
This is a really good broken rice restaurant in District 1 - Ho Chi Minh City .

Their rib grilling recipe is almost perfect, the ribs are marinated with delicious flavors and just the right amount of time, allowing all the flavors to permeate the entire rib, creating a dish that is imbued with Vietnamese culture, pure and original.

I am very satisfied with all the toppings here, egg rolls, fried duck eggs, dried fish, fried pate, even pickled cabbage, everything is very neat.

The fish sauce here is really great, the seaweed soup that comes with it is also delicious.

All this makes for a wonderful dish, I highly recommend it and you should definitely try it.

This unassuming com tam place is awesome. So authentic, the pork chop was huge - the chilli, so spicy but tasty. Get the extra egg topping üôè 10/10 loved it would return. Only a quick grab ride from district 1, totally worth it. Love the music - vibes are top tier.

The c∆°m s∆∞·ªùn was absolutely delicious, perfectly grilled and full of flavor! But what really blew me away was the fish sauce. Hands down one of the best I‚Äôve had with c∆°m s∆∞·ªùn‚Äîbalanced, bold, and addictive. I guarantee you‚Äôre going to come back to eat at this place again because it‚Äôs that good!

The rip was perfectly cooked with crispy exterior and tender inside, the egg york is chewy, meat pie was good too, the fish sauce is thick and sweet. All of it mixed together enhances flavors. Staffs are so nice and kind, make us feel warm and inviting. We were so sorry that the waitress spilled hot seaweed soup on her hand, thanksfully it was not bad. We didn‚Äôt have to wait, the service was super fast and the food was still hot when served.

Super fantastic broken rice with a wide variety of toppings! We got a chicken one and a ribs one. The meats were tender and caramelized to perfection, and the sides and fried eggs were divine. Service was really attentive and the food came out hot and very quickly. Great fish sauce that wasn‚Äôt too salty, and well balanced. The space is small but homey, and it‚Äôs not too hard to find in the alley, as it is bright yellow. Motorbike Parking is a bit cramped, but available.
Best c∆°m t·∫•m in all of Saigon. Smoky, juicy, well seasoned pork
What a great find. Great food, good service and reasonable prices. Some of the best pork ribs I've had in a long time. Just go there. You won't be disappointed

The establishment offers a delectable rendition of ‚Äòc∆°m t·∫•m,‚Äô or broken rice, characterized by its exceptional taste and superior quality. Notably, the menu features several distinctive dishes, including the intriguing ‚Äòpate √°p ch·∫£o.‚Äô Situated within the first alley on the right-hand side of Tr·∫ßn ƒê√¨nh Xu Street‚Äîwhen approached from the direction of Tr·∫ßn H∆∞ng ƒê·∫°o‚Äîthe restaurant exudes a cozy ambiance. Very nice place to have Com Tam.

You can see the marinated meat being barbecued in from of you, and it tasted flavorful and tender.

The dish was only 30K for a quite fulfilling portion.

The service is super fast.

This was super delicious and no frills - there's no english menu here, so your best bet is to show them a photo and ask for "same same". Two pork chops and an egg cost 30k, and you get free iced tea to sip on.

Highly recommended if you can bear the heat of eating on the street (and if not, probably best to come super early in the morning or after peak heat hours)

Delicious c∆°m t·∫•m s∆∞·ªùn served up quickly and at very reasonable prices. The owner was friendly, and her son, I believe, was kind enough to get me a coffee from around the corner. Highly recommended!

Super good C∆°m t·∫•m ( broken rice ).
It was super cheap (50.000 / p)
Very nice food for the price.
Great com tam, broken seasoned rice with grilled porkfilet and veggies. Eat on the street, nice people, local prices - also for us tourists. And good free cold ice tea. Five stars.
friendly owner, reasonable price, must try

0x31752fc4b07ba49d:0xa571105058415d9.comment: Best com tam we‚Äôve had so far. Grilled pork was nice and tender, reasonable price. Seller can speak English. Had twice in a day.

At first I think the pork will be dry, hard and to sweet. But after eat there, i think the pork is very good. The meat is tender, not too dry and the taste has sweet but still has savory flavour. The price is not expensive compared to the portion and taste. The place is only inside small road with open air with dining table, but it was pretty clean. I would recommend to eat here if you go to saigon.

10/10 food. Great little local spot. Cheap prices and always busy. You could probably order anything on the menu and it would be good. We got the best seller pork ribs and came back again twice for the same thing. Food arrives less than 10 mins after ordering.
Yum! Delicious pork ribs with rice and egg. Street food, with some tables. Seemed clean. Definitely worth a try!

This was our first meal in Ho Chi Minh, mostly because we got in kind of late night and this place is open 24 hours. Nonetheless, what I learned was some of the best hidden gems are served out of some sketchy looking alleys üòÖ

So many people were ordering takeaway or trying to get a seat here, so many of them locals. That's how I knew, this place was legit.

They specialize in broken rice with grilled pork, and they're absolute masterclasses at it. Chef's kiss, definitely try it, it's not only a very Vietnamese experience to eat in an alley, but it's also a steal of a price.
Cost spot, tucked inside an alleyway. The iced Kamquat tea was super refreshing. Meat and egg loaf were delicious and just an all round satisfying meal that‚Äôs wallet friendly.

Most succulent, flavorful pork, a hidden! Really great dishes, and pretty big menu, too. Fairly priced. Its hidden in a little alleyway, and its nice to sit down there. They also do takeout. Definitely a must visit if you're in HCM!
A nice meal to try in the morning. A full proportion meal that gives you a good boost of energy. I like the pork and the shredded pork skin.

0x31752faf236547ef:0x7dbb32100ec46825.comment: Goodness they allowed us to bring in the food from opposite. Their Com Tam is delicious, ordered the combo that comes with meat patty and pork skin. Personally and my queen we would opt out from the pork skin, the grilled pork is already a 100. We ordered Sombersby and a black glutinous rice yoghurt too. Overall a satisfying meal

Horrible Experience.
Rice with one piece of small pork meat is 60,000VND + TAX 8%. Normal local price is 30,000(VND) with No TAX,
Too noisy and no manner to customer. Serving time tooks long more then 25minute, finally I asked to take out as like a 7-11 meal kits.
Be careful, Now it's price up and be charging TAX. What the hack! TRY TO REAL LOCAL Restaurants, This place is FAKE.

I go with my family. The restaurant is located near the walking street in the centre of District 1. The dish is appetising and delicious. The price makes me quite satisfied. We went to the restaurant in the evening and there were a lot of foreign tourists

The broken rice is quite delicious, the fish sauce is fragrant, the ribs are well seasoned, the pork belly and eggs are delicious but the price is too expensive, more suitable for Western customers than for our customers.

Went here last month and had my first broken rice. I got the set meal with grilled pork chop, shredded pork skin, and a meat patty. The food was okay‚Äîpork chop was pretty good, and the sauce complemented it well. The meat patty was just alright, but I didn‚Äôt like the shredded pork skin. The place is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food came out fast. Prices are super reasonable.
C∆°m t·∫•m done right! The grilled pork is cooked fresh right in front of you, and the n∆∞·ªõc ch·∫•m is perfecto‚Äîperfectly balanced and full of flavor.

Came here for lunch on a friend's recommendation, and we were super happy we did. The food was really tasty, the staff was friendly, and it was very reasonably priced. We both got the broken rice with an egg, a pork chop, plus I added a meat patty to mine. Both were very delicious.  The pork chop was grilled by an aunty right outside. The eggs and rice were cooked perfectly! Don't miss the sweet fish sauce situation on the table.

Seriously, what the hell is this, now charging 8% Tax only for Foreigner??? What a scam! On principle, that the last time I eat there. It's definitely not about the money, it's about Principle. And I'm here very often and ate there and ordered a lot before. If you're a Foreigner, don't encourage this dishonest place. There is plenty of fantastic and honest Vietnamese locals with great businesses all around that are not treating us Foreigner with such disrespect and racism. Again, on Principle, never again. Just with me, they lost several months of scamming Foreigner with their dishonest taxes.

0x31752f8419f4bcfb:0x7f0fa38b2793d62f.comment:
Please go here if you‚Äôre ever in HCMC!

Everything is prepared fresh, the young man who works here speaks English and they bring the food out super quick and it‚Äôs super cheap!

Me and my girlfriend ordered pork chop with broken rice and an egg, you also get an omelette type thing and a bowl of broth, and for ¬£2 ($2.50)! It‚Äôs really really tasty and substantial!

Would 100% recommend.
They have high quality meat with soft fat skin and nuoc mam sauce was really balanced not that sweet. Highly recommend for your fancy lunch or dinner !!

Excellent com tam eaten here today and ready good price. I've given 5‚≠ê because it's street food so the atmosphere was perfect as it's right on a busy street and the service was quick and friendly. I had crispy pork and it was 40k

Excellent food!! We are staying nearby and thought we‚Äôd try this place as it seems so popular with the locals. There is a reason for that. It‚Äôs absolutely brilliant!

So affordable and a proper meal. We recommend the pork and rice which they serve with an egg, omelette and soup. This is proper Vietnamese food! Recommended to anyone visiting Saigon

Best com tam in Vietnam.
Went here already many time‚Äôs, always top.

Best com tam stall so far to me, may not be recognized when walking by, but offered the best dish.
Staffs are friendly and they serve such a generous portion.
Amazing street food pure Saigon vibe
The best com tam from a street stall that I've come across. A little South from the hustle and bustle of Bui Vien, this place is worth the visit.

0x31752f06f4edb6c1:0xc64cc1f24447502b.comment: This is a great place to eat Com Tam. The meat is juicy and I especially like the fish sauce. The price is a bit higher than what you would pay for an average Com Tam in Saigon but the facilities are also nicer than at a typical Com Tam Place. They have an air-conditioned room upstairs with some nice decoration. Each Com Tam comes with free soil as well as some free fruits as a desert. The price for a "full topping‚Äú Com Tam is 135k. I would also like to highlight the very friendly and polite service.

The staffs are super slow and lazy. Always on their phone watching something. I order and wait for 30 minutes. NOTHING!!! And then they ask me to o·ªèder AGAIN and wait for 15 minutes. TRASH. Poorly trained staffs with bad attitudes. 11:40 19.10.2025 Literally empty tables!
Food, service and atmosphere are all good. The only minus is that it's hard for parking.

The broken rice here is the best I had in HCM. The pork chop was a bit sweet, the steamed egg meat loaf was very firm. The pickled water spinnach was quite interesting. It came with a small bowl of purple taro congee soup and dessert. It's slightly more expensive than the average but worth it. Staff was very friendly.

0x31752f8f5eae1f51:0x2d972c10b08f6456.comment:
Visited as a tourist and I‚Äôd rate it around 7.5/10. The food was decent (though the broken rice here wasn‚Äôt as good as other spots I‚Äôve tried). Service is friendly, and the place feels more suitable for solo diners or couples since it‚Äôs quite busy and rushed.

Prices are very reasonable at 55‚Äì60k VND in District 1, so no complaints there. I‚Äôd call it a local food vendor with decent quality and good value , just don‚Äôt expect too much.

My dad love the bittergourd soup he had in the morning. I searched around and found this place. Even though the taste losses out to the morning place, but it was still decent! Ordered com tam suon trung (broken rice with grilled pork chop and fried egg) as well~

Super good especially if you wanna eat like a local. Ate twice here and the food never disappointed. I always picked #4 with an extra order of egg. Highly recommend for those who wanna experience Com tam!

If you want authentic Vietnamese dinner, this is it. Don‚Äôt expect English language service, just point and get.
I sat down and really enjoyed a pork chop delight cooked over charcoal.
Really inexpensive as it is local food.

Had their soup noodles here for dinner. Very crowded place popular with locals. The soup noodles were tasty but it‚Äôs a weird taste in the sense they mix pork slices with pork liver and a shrimp. It‚Äôs like a meat broth but with a tinge of seafood flavour. The place is full and are mostly locals having their meals. Very busy place to eat. In all I enjoyed my meal.
I had the Com tam with a fried egg and it was very nice and reasonably priced. The pork chop was grilled over a charcoal barbecue.
Absolutely delicious pork and shredded rice. The service is very efficient. You need to arrive early as it is quite popular.

The best com tam in Vietnam has to been eaten out of tourist areas! This place ticks all the boxes - delicious, reasonable price and most importantly, service is fast too.

The only barrier is that the waiter here speaks very limited English which is hard for those who wants to request for additional add ons.

0x31752f6a99502683:0xf4b1d1cabb7008cb.comment: Best food I've had in Vietnam! The guys can speak English better than me and are really helpful . The relationship price/quality is excellent.
Classic com tam with huge portions. One of the best in the city. The family that owns it is quite friendly as well and speak decent English.

One of the best Com Tam I've ever had. If you only eat com tam once in HCMC, don't miss this.  The pork chop was thick, juicy and had a really smokey flavour.  Lots of rice and the sunnyside egg on top was perfect.  Highly recommend.

üá¶üá∫ AUS Tourist Review üá¶üá∫

Was recommended this place by a local and it did not disappoint! Great selection of food from a cart to choose from which you eat next door in a seating area. There are chilli's and other condiments to enhance your eating experience. Easily top 2 on my list of eating places for Ho Chi Minh.
Amazingly tasting food and the service was quick and efficient. Highly recommend üëçüèΩ

Best com tam in town

Owners are super nice and the food checks all the boxes. A must try !

Small restaurant in a busy small street (almost alley like).Don't make the mistake I made ... by going into the first building if you come from the left side of the store (small scolding from the auntie). There's three and the dining area is in the third.
Ordering can be challenging and there was only one person that spoke some English.
Translate and pictures from other people online can and will certainly help you as a tourist or non VN speaking person.
I had a simple bbq porkchop over rice with some pickled vegetables for 38k vnd. A great price for a tourist but can't comment it from a local perspective.
The porkchop was amazing. Very well seasoned and loved the smoky flavor. Despite it not being cooked on order, the porkchop was very tender and not dry at all. Kinda wished I had asked for a double porkchop.
They forgot my iced green tea and getting the staff's attention is rather difficult. A lot of moving around but not actually looking around (general dining experience in these types of places).
Did I mind it? Not at all, the meal had left me quite satisfied.
Definitely a place I would recommend if you're in the area.

Absolutely bloody excellent. The com tam is fantastic, as was the canh o qua (stuffed bitter melon)!

Uncle serving us was super lovely!!!! Cam on chu!

0x31752fec547c9a87:0x3e799d325f623fe9.comment: in the alley, right across the Pink Church. Very humble Vietnam style homey food, very tasty big portion. Roasted pork belly was to die for, thick crispy savory. Sauteed vegies, fresh cucumber and pickled caisim on the side plus a sweet-sour soup of bean sprout, radish and tomato.

This joint is very popular at lunch time. The food is delicious and cheap. The pickled mustard leaves, though not a lot, add a different twist from the usual cucumber. Soup and tea are free. They alley has a lot of annoying motorcycle traffic.

0x31752f478a7ceb17:0xdcb87db311325ae8.comment: Food is bland. Staffs would ignore you. Prices does not include tax or service charge. We ordered bun cha but did not give us water for the rice paper until we asked for it. Will charge you for wet tissue. The only thing interesting in this restaurant is the interiors. Food not great.  Vi Da Vietnamese eatery at Ben Thahn market was so much better.  Feels like typical chain restaurant using frozen meats cooked without any soul.

I‚Äôve been in Vietnam for a couple of days and I couldn‚Äôt find anywhere that had that fresh vietnamese food i was looking for, until I found Com Tam Moc!!

100% Recommend

This isn‚Äôt a large place. It‚Äôs well decorated, very hip. The walls are made of brick so voices bounced quite a bit. Fortunately the patrons keeps the voice down, but unfortunately some the waiter would yell across the room breaking the silence.

It appears to have 4 person in the front (waiters), I don‚Äôt know how many in the back. They are so so slow. ok this one kinda nice c∆°m t·∫•m (broken rice) spot i‚Äôve hit in saigon recently, maybe the best for tourist. it‚Äôs a bit pricey for c∆°m t·∫•m and def feels a little catered to tourists, but honestly‚Ä¶ i‚Äôd still go back.

the s∆∞·ªùn n∆∞·ªõng (grilled pork chop) hits hard‚Äîperfectly caramelized edges, juicy inside, the marinade‚Äôs that sweet-savory goodness done right. the c∆°m (rice) itself‚Äôs fluffy and lightly fragrant, not dry like at other places. big win: they give plenty of m·ª° h√†nh (scallion oil) and m·∫Øm ch·∫•m (fish sauce dip), balanced just right‚Äînot too sugary, not too pungent. love that.

skip the soup unless you‚Äôre really craving side quests.

0x31752f8438b1e4d9:0x5ccf45ed9954be68.comment:
I came here impressed by the rating and I was not disappointed. The food was very good, though not exceptional. Well-executed C∆°m T·∫•m. And definitely go for the ribs! That's the difference-maker!

Other then that, the place is clean and the staff was nice.

We ordered C∆°m T·∫•m for a company get-together, and wow, everyone was absolutely raving about it! My foreign colleague, who's tried C∆°m T·∫•m before, was especially impressed. She couldn't stop talking about how incredibly tasty and generous the portions were ‚Äì definitely the best she's had!
Everything from the professional, tidy, and super hygienic packaging to the food itself was top-notch. The C∆°m T·∫•m quality hit the spot. The pork chop and pork rib were perfectly seasoned, tender, and still incredibly juicy even after delivery. And that fish sauce? It was the ideal complement, bringing all the flavors together beautifully.
Even the smaller details shone through: the sunny-side up egg was cooked to perfection, and both the seaweed soup and Vietnamese sour soup were delicious additions. We were all incredibly happy with the service and the entire experience.
If you don't mind spending extra for quality, this place really knows how to deliver a winning meal!

Personally I felt the meal would not be better without its tasty condiments, soup and egg meat loaf ! They are really awesome.

Close your eyes and order the combo which is so worth it !

Had this takeaway as I was rushing and on the go. So well packed, so meticulous, and absolutely delicious. Well deserving of their ratings. This was 89,000 vnd and I enjoyed every bit, including the seaweed soup. A small qualm is that the pork chop is hard to cut with the plastic cutlery, I had to get my scissors to cut it. Maybe they can consider helping to do that for takeaway.

Staff was friendly and helpful and quick and even told me to go upstairs where there is ac.
The pork cutlet unfortunately was dry and no char with minimal grill flavour. Only the fatty rim was juicy.
They made an effort to make the place looks nice with wooden tables and stools, brick facade on the wall and a mix of real and plastic plants.
Personally I prefer the street side shop that grill it on coals, not sure if they do that here, couldn't see the grilling, though it didn't taste like it was.

Sooooo good! We‚Äôve tried both the Hanoi location and this one and hands down‚Äî taste and quality is amazing. We actually like it better than a certain Michelin Guide one also in town. The meat is tender and soft here, rice seasoned just right. Also their side of soup has minced pork and seaweed. Super tasty!
It is very different from other `comtam' restaurants in Ho Chi Minh City. It is clean and so cool because there's an air conditioner.

This is a good sized, two-story spot offers a dining experience that combines convenience, comfort, and culture. You place your order on the main floor and then head upstairs to enjoy the air-conditioned seating area‚Äîa welcome retreat on a hot day. The service is efficient, with food arriving in about 5 minutes.

The decor is inviting, featuring the story of the restaurant beautifully displayed on the walls. The placemats double as guides, providing instructions on how to eat com tam (broken rice), which adds an educational touch for first-timers. The menu is also written in English, making it accessible to tourists. The upbeat music and thoughtful design create a comfortable, welcoming environment.

As for the food, it scores a solid 4/5. The pork rib was the highlight‚Äîjuicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. However, the pork cutlet was slightly dry, which took away from the overall experience. The accompanying soups were both delicious, adding depth to the meal. That said, we wished the plates came with more vegetables to balance out the richness of the meats.

Overall, this restaurant is a great place for a quick, flavorful meal in a relaxed setting. A few tweaks, like juicier pork cutlets and a more generous vegetable portion, would make it exceptional.

0x31752f51fbd26543:0x51f16da433a54743.comment:
Great c∆°m t·∫•m spot in a lively, very local neighborhood in District 3. The pork chop is well-marinated and nicely grilled, with a good balance of flavors and less sweet than others. A generous portion with pork chop and egg costs 57K, which is a good deal for the quality.

It‚Äôs just about walking distance from Pham Ngu Lao, making it a great option if you want to escape the tourist-heavy areas and try something more local. Well worth the effort!

I have to say this is the best Com Tam I have ever had after spending 3+yrs in Vietnam eating out every single day. I have probably tried 50+ com tam stores across Vietnam, but this tops the rest. The food serve in a very nice display, taste is above average, one of the best I had try before. Friendly boss

Traditional com tam place in a local area. The pork ribs were tender and juicy. Rice was fragrant and texture is interesting as it is soft but not sticky.

While the broken rice with pork jowl is this eatery's signature dish, after experiencing it, I left thought that this eatery was completely overrated. Their shredded pork skin lacked the satisfying crispness and the distinct toasted rice aroma. The portion size was meager, the rice undercooked with a rough texture, and there was no complimentary soup included. An additional VND 20.000 per cup buys you soup, but the selection rotates daily between just two options. On Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday, the soup is made from pickled mustard greens and beef tendons. On Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday, there will be seaweed soup with pork cartilage.

eating here since a long time already. really worth a try. positive attitude of service and good food. price is affordable. a bit hard to find only. hope this review encourage you to try out. take the n·∫°c gi√≤n b√¨ la, it is my fav

There is this really sweet old lady working there, I think she might be the owner of the store. Although she doesn't speak English, she was super friendly and welcoming, she was so nice and checking up on me if I enjoyed the food and if I wanted to order anything else.

Definitely would recommend this place although it's quite far away from the city center!

0x31752f562a304d5b:0x444d84ce8af1b2b6.comment:
This hidden broken rice spot is tucked away down a little alley, and is mostly frequented by locals. They sell out super fast, so if you arrive around 10:30 AM, you might find them already packing up for the day.

There is a few seats lining the alley and some inside a house, but the pork chops are grilled right at the entrance to the alley. Hence, no smoke smell even the space is limited.

The pork chops look fantastic, but I found them a bit sour and chewy. I suspect the meat might have been marinated for too long or perhaps the charcoal was a bit too hot.

Overall, the broken rice is decent value for money, and the ladies who run it are really friendly and welcoming.

0x31752f2314baa5f7:0x2d1b112fee9517a6.comment: My wife and I came here for our first meal of our 4-day vacation and everything was great. The food is fresh and flavorful and the service and staff were great. I would come back again. They even set us up with complimentary tea and soup on our visit. I highly recommend this place!

noodles were simple and on its own did not really have any taste, but i wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way because it was a perfect complement to the perfectly grilled meat and the meat spring roll looking thing. Everything went well together and I only regret not being able to stuff more of this lovely dish into my belly. the ice lemon tea is also not the usual taste you get but really good!!

this stall is a good symbol of street food, because you are literally on the street with a small table and toddler chairs (I‚Äôm 6‚Äù2 but I was still happy), i read another review about red ants in the area but i didn‚Äôt encounter that.

MUST TRY! Highly recommend if you are in district 1!

Best dishes we had in Saigon! Run by family, nothing fancy but simple food made very well with kind service and warm smile. We had one dish with grilled pork chops and other dish with pork chops, pork skins and meat pie. Nouc Sam sauce and cooked chives are really good with the dish! They even included iced tea before the meal and fresh banana after!

We came at around 10am and they were consistently busy with local people doing takeaways. We walked 20mins and it was worth visiting!

More popular in district 3. The foods are rather okay as long as with the price. ‚ÄúS∆∞·ªùn B√¨ Ch·∫£‚Äù is the favorite orders. ‚ÄúCh·∫£‚Äù is more special than others, highly recommend to have it. Price is more acceptable compare with the quality of food. The soup is pretty okay. The shop is too small, with maximum serving about Ten customers at once time. No air conditioner, so it is so hot when having at lunch time.

Amazing local food and really effortable price. We ordered two broken rice, one with pork rib, skin and meat pie, and another with caramelised pork and eggs at only 125 thousand VND. Comes with soups and drinks. You can smell the grilled pork while you enjoy your meals. The staff are friendly and one of them can speak English. The only disadvantage is the settings are quite limited. Many ordered and take away. I feel that the food tastes better than restaurants.

Delicious Vietnamese "broken rice" cuisine, a local favourite that all visitors to Vietnam must try. The dishes at this shop are especially good as they are still prepared and cooked in-house at the shop and not supplied by a central kitchen in a factory complex.
Broken rice cuisine is a combination of grilled pork chop, cold cuts, pork skin, and egg cake (otherwise known in Vietnamese as "suon, bi,cha"). Do remember to eat the meal with a bowl of bitter melon soup.

I'm pretty sure this is tourist trap. Whatever the media says, do not come here.

The rice is lousy, not fragrant Vietnamese rice.

The price is 95K for the few stuff I ordered. You can get it for 40k elsewhere.

The food were so so.... Normal. I would never even eat such food under normal circumstances.
Good stuff around Saigon! The pork and meat pie were delicious. I‚Äôll definitely go back!!!!

0x3175296d72aa296b:0xa6bead5acbe711b9.comment: Food was delicious and very close to my hotel, will definitely be coming here again before I leave back for America.
Great restaurant to try C∆°m T·∫•m, directly next to our hotel. Very friendly owners, we felt welcome. Recommended for everyone in the area.
Excelent food. Excelent service. It taste like home, it taste like family.

As a Local Guide and a big fan of Vietnamese cuisine, I can confidently say that C∆°m T·∫•m B·ª•i S√†i G√≤n is a must-try spot in District 1! I visited this place after reading some good reviews, and it absolutely lived up to the hype.
The broken rice (c∆°m t·∫•m) here is flavorful and well-balanced. I tried the grilled pork chop with egg and pickled vegetables ‚Äî the meat was juicy and marinated perfectly, and the rice had a nice texture. The fish sauce (n∆∞·ªõc m·∫Øm) was delicious and not overly salty. Portion size was generous for the price.
The restaurant is clean, organized, and gives off a very local and authentic Saigon vibe. Staff were friendly, helpful, and served food quickly even during busy hours. Also, I loved how the menu was easy to understand even for non-Vietnamese speakers.
It‚Äôs conveniently located on 100 Th·∫°ch Th·ªã Thanh, just 8 minutes from the city center, and stays open until 10 PM ‚Äî perfect for late lunch or early dinner.
Highly recommend this place to tourists and locals alike looking for a high-quality, affordable Vietnamese meal.

Saw this place the other day while walking and made a mental note to come back. So glad we came back for lunch today as it was delicious!

We were greeted by a friendly employee in English. We told him what we wanted. He offered to have an egg added to each of our plates which we definitely wanted. It's not listed on the menu but it looks like from other reviews they give it as an option upon ordering.

We took a seat and our food was served in under 5 mins. We did not order tea but it was brought to us. I'm not sure if we were charged for it but my husband said each of our meals cost about $80k.

We both ordered the honey pork chop which was so juicy and flavorful! Cannot wait to come back again.

There was nothing special about the atmosphere. Could have been cleaner but not unhygienic. You get what you pay for.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend C∆°m T·∫•m B·ª•i S√†i G√≤n. Their menu is very misleading. It lists ‚Äúb√¨, ch·∫£, ·ªëp la‚Äù as 12k/1 ph·∫ßn, which implies that all three items together cost 12k. But when the bill comes, each item is charged separately. This feels dishonest and misleading. The food quality and taste are just average‚Äînot worth the confusion or the surprise at checkout.

üçö üçñ ü•ï solid com tam, good portion size and great for lunch. The fish sauce is not as sweet here. I prefer a bit sweeter but this may be good depending on your taste. Good location and comes with iced tea of course.

This place has a claim to sell the best C∆°m T·∫•m in S√†i G√≤n. The portion size, taste, quality and price is excellent. Plus the soups are fantastic! I particularly love the dill and clam soup. Cannot recommend this place highly enough üòã

This was and still is one of my favorite places.  The price here is reasonable.. and tbh, there is broken rice everywhere, but here it feels like the ingredients are good quality, there are many that use low quality to cut costs.  There are only a few places I can say this about with my experience living and working in Vietnam for 10 years now.  ‚ù§Ô∏èüòª
Food is simple and delicious. Rice, pork, soup are hot, very rare to find in Vietnam. Price is 86k slightly more expensive but pricing is transparent. Service is good. Free iced tea too!

I've never been a fan of c∆°m t·∫•m but th√≠s place h√°s changed my mind! The highlight of the meal is the ch·∫£! It's tender, juicy, and flavourful! I recommend getting at least 2. The free jasmine cold tea is great as well, very fragrant and flavourful! I guess if you're a local it's considered on the pricer side for c∆°m t·∫•m but its super cheap for someone from Canada. Highly recommended!

0x317529e54e87e99f:0xf937df891b1841ef.comment: Since the eatery is nestled in a small alley, parking might be limited. The eatery offers more than just their grilled pork chops, the delicious array of dishes displayed at the counter is sure to tempt you. Every order comes with a side of sliced cucumbers and a bowl of pork rinds, with free refills on the rinds. Complimentary iced tea is served at every table with attentive water refills. However, accompanying soup is not included, you have to purchase it separately.

Great c∆°m t·∫•m place. Open from 18:00-23:00. The food might be a bit sweet but this is common in southern Vietnam. Even though it's  sweet, it taste very good. It's very cheap in my opinion. But this ks the best C∆°m t·∫•m I've had so far in Ho Chi Minh City

Daily open from 5pm to 11pm (have a day-off on Saturday). Location in the small alley with only suitable for motorists. More popular night Broken rices in Hang Xanh Junction, Binh Thanh district. Foods are delicious and tasty with reasonable price.

One of my favorite C∆°m T·∫•m spots in HCMC. It‚Äôs tucked in a quiet little alley off the main street in Binh Thanh and they have consistent good quality.

Personally, I‚Äôm a big fan of the chili side on the table and the tr√† ƒë√° is good as well! They also understand my Vietnamese very well so as a basic-level speaker and foreigner I‚Äôm very comfortable to go here and order. Check it out for good food and a nice low key experience!
This com tam store is located in a small alley. The meat is tender and the flavor is very good. You can park against the wall in front of the store, but there is not many peking spots.
40k for this ( rice with fish üêü). Menu not available thr.

I didn't understand why this com tam place has such high reviews... until I visited it with my boyfriend.

The pork and chicken were thoroughly marinated and were grilled to perfection - leaving with a nice smokey taste. Yet, it was not dry at all. It was tender and at times, the chicken fell right off the bone.

We visited this place frequently and would highly recommend others to try it.
We had 2 broken rice with grilled pork, 2 soups of the day and extra chicken. Total price is 150k VND. Both are good but the chicken is exceptional. Must try. Definitely come back for more.

0x31752fd792d14fc9:0x791bf2072f91081.comment: This sidewalk broken rice stall offers delicious food, with tasty toppings, and incredibly fragrant honey-marinated meat. Plus free soup on the side. However, the price rivals some nicer restaurants in the central district, which seems a bit steep for a street vendor. The service is also lacking, it is messy and disorganised, and I had to repeat my order multiple times, only to receive an incorrect dish. While the food is fantastic, the price and service might prevent me from coming back.

This unassuming, alleyway com tam stand was the most delicious meal I had in HCMC -- the clean plate says it all! The pork was tender with the right balance of sweet/savory. It's a hidden gem I wouldn't want anyone to miss
Authentic Vietnamese broken rice ‚Äî affordable, big portions, well worth it.
Lu√¥n lu√¥n ngon! This is my favorite com tam place. People of Saigon are lucky to get to eat food like this for a reasonable price.
Thank you very much for the good food and great prices

0x31752ee1415a23d7:0xbf3929ae27fff045.comment: "com tam" not really delicious but good for eat compare with the price. big portion. great service.

Reasonable prices (broken rice with grilled pork chop and another topping for VND 35.000). However, the crowdedness of the eatery is overwhelming. Even with a large staff of 7-9 people, service seems stretched thin. The hot and stuffy environment felt more suited for take-out. The watercress soup was particularly disappointing. The watercress itself seemed undercooked, and the broth lacked flavour. It appeared they prepared the soup by adding raw vegetables directly to bowls with premade clear broth, resulting in an unpleasant, pungent taste.
Personal opinion - Cold, thin strips of rock hard grilled pork chops. Don't know what to say further.
Delicious broken rice, make sure to get it with pork.
good c∆°m t·∫•m, cannot complain, but there are other places just as good.. bit crowded when i visited.
Steak n fish sauce are good

The food looked just like the photos on the menu. The flavor was lovely and the workers were super friendly. The shop is just a little small for space, but other than that, we would definitely come again!

For 2 meals (including the beverage and soup) we only spent 171,000 VND so it was a great value for our money.
Cheap 35k Pork and rice with a 5k soft drink. The service is really quick too!

reccomended!

Not good at all!!!
I should not eat there when I arrived as it was a roadside hawker with no proper shelter.
However, it seemed will rain soon so I decided to have a quick bite.
Ordered the special spare ribs instead of the normal pork chop. The feeling was the same as one of the reviews.
The spare rib was a bit salty and without a good smell of honey, it was cool as usual as they normally grilled and then put them aside and wait for the order.
It costed me VND110.000 /115.000 and a total of VND130.000 including one fried egg and one cup of iced tea. And they didn‚Äôt even offer you a complimentary soup as of the other shops.
I can‚Äôt image such a dish of food and environment costs me more than double or even triple the price if you eat in the local wet market.
No service , ordinary good , expensive price ‚Ä¶..

The food was cold and mushy. I saw the high reviews and decided to give this place a try. There are several piles of pork meat sitting at the window to attract customers, thus when you come to the shop they pick one of the piece that's been sitting on the window to feed you. It's a cold and very tough piece of meat. The cha was mushy, like it was over cooked, no texture at all. I would never eat here again and would advise anyone I know to not try it.
Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to call it the best Com Tam in Saigon.

Just visited recently, was looking for an authentic meal and found just the spot, a hidden gem :) Food portions are a decent size and the flavours amazing! Very reasonable prices. Eating areas are kept clean and tidy. We also found the service was great. Would definitely visit again and will be sure to recommend to anyone visiting the area.

The rice is very dry, the grilled ribs are tough, too much MSG, and the price is high compared to the average(approximately 120k per dish). A bad experience, I‚Äôm allergic to MSG, and it seems the vendor uses too much of it.

Side of the road specialising in Com tam. Rice was nice but the star of the show is the juice fatty pork rib. Yes it's a bit more expensive than other places but it is definitely a must try. Seaweed soup was great too.

Follow @bredgyeats on instagram for more food posts!

Ca Hu Kho To - A braise that‚Äôs on the saltier side, with a tender and flaky catfish with a moist texture. The fish sauce aroma is prominent, and there are some decorative green peppercorns and perhaps a hint of spice?

Suon, Cha - Porkchop has a mild char and decent caramelization, and has a tasty sweet and savory marinade. Although, it‚Äôs a bit dry but not too tough, and has a lean texture. The egg meatloaf is a bit firmer and meatier than usually, which I appreciate for its leaner feel and clean pork umami, with an eggy aroma that you can actually taste, although it is missing woodear.

Someone was smoking inside though, which was rather unpleasant.

Visit: October 2025

Had the com tam suon bi Cha and it was alright. The highlight of it was definitely the steamed egg cake, which is the best I've had, as it has real crab in it. The pork chop was dry, but had a good charcoal taste. It was definitely on the more expensive side at 120k (when normal prices I've seen around are closer to 45k). We also had iced coffee, which tasted pretty watered down and was overpriced at 25k (vs much better street food iced coffees)
Came here on our last day in Ho Chi Minh. Packed busy with locals. We easily ordered 6 dishes between 2. Although more expensive than we thought, worth it for the taste. Not disappointed!
Small portion and very pricey comparing to local eateries, but the food quality is great. I think it is the best com tam I've ever had.

Was ok, better the first visit than second

Not great, but not dirty either.

This place is pretty busy, I like places where the food isn't sitting around too long.

I would stop here if convenient, but not go out of my way.

Excellent choice of com tam. A bit expensive though compared to other com tam around the area
Charging foreigners double. Food is not bad....

I recently visited this location and had the opportunity to dine on the 2nd floor. While I understand that the staff may have been tired due to a busy day, I was disappointed by the lack of professionalism I encountered. 0x31752ed2dbf2e94b:0x64143c1b0172b88c.comment: A standard Korean spicy noodles chain. 0x31752990a2a81a2f:0xce0d313fc8c60725.comment:
I really don't know where these high ratings come from.
I'd give the special pho -- 2.5 stars. Flavours don't meld and it's just a bit bland.
The bo kho was decent -- 3.5 stars but there's still major room for improvement.

Many people do come here in the morning. But I do not recommend letting the Google rating be the reason to come.

Authentic and busy place near our apartment. We tried b√≥ beefsteak with egg for breakfast and it looked good and tasted great as well. Reasonable prices, quick service. We don‚Äôt have much to compare yet, but we were satisfied. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Great bo kho, but I don‚Äôt think you wanna get their pho. I tried both and the broth of their pho has a unique herbal flavor, which I didn‚Äôt enjoy much even though the meat in the bowl was pretty good. Their bo kho was much better and the meat in the bowl was so tender and great as well. Another good note is their vegetables are super fresh.

Pho Be Thanh Da is one of the pho restaurants in District 1 that is loved by many people. This pho restaurant is very well known thanks to its convenient location right on Hoang Sa Street. This is enough to make customers love it so much.
Unlike regular pho restaurants that choose beef as the main ingredient, at Pho Be Thanh Da, it is cooked entirely from veal. The veal bones are stewed to make broth, the remaining meat is divided into small pieces and served in the veal pho dish.

The flavor of the restaurant's dishes is very rich, combined with the pho broth made from veal bones that have been stewed for many hours. Each bowl of pho is very carefully prepared from the pho broth to the arrangement of the ingredients in the bowl of pho, which is very eye-catching.

The typical flavor of Pho Be Thanh Da is a light sweetness at first, but later on it will make you addicted and miss it, it is a different flavor compared to many other pho flavors.

Been in Saigon for 6 years and only recently discovered this spot.  The broth is on point and offers a good selection of meats compared to more normal pho spots.  This place is now part of my rotation
Best food we've had so far. Pho and Bo Ko very good

Busy place
Quick service
Good value
Tasty pho and has a good variety of fresh herbs
Clean enough

0x31752f00083fa2fd:0x23041b10d6654d2b.comment: Food was tasty! Excellent Pho combo with meat and chicken. Beef was very tender and the needles were soft. Small cozy place with four tables. Even though it rained heavily, management got us inside to eat by the street front and watch the rain pour as we ate.

The most satisfying pho i have ever had. The owner here is super friendly and helpful. She put those sauces into our noodles in local way for us. The price is reasonable and nice local vibe as well. Thanks for giving us a good meal before we leave Ho Chi Minh!)

Pho Viet Nam is my first authentic pho in Ho Chi Minh. The serving is generous, good for 2-3, and the lady in the store helped prepare my bowl with the toppings and condiments.

I like that this place has local vibes, in front of the street. The broth is not super thick, so it‚Äôs good for me. Not many leafy veggies so also good. Just right amount of basil.

I chose the place because of the many google reviews, but I would also venture out other spots nearby, to have comparison. :)

The owner is very nice and so proactive. Food is so delicious, we tried the special pho here! We finished these 2 bowls in minutes. Serving is very generous. 1 bowl is good for 2-3 persons. It was the first pho we‚Äôve tried after landing in Vietnam and it did not disappoint!

We ordered the beef and chicken ph·ªü, and moved into the inner dining area when the rain started pouring. The place has the charm of an authentic roadside stall, run by an elderly woman and a young man. Service was friendly and laid-back. The food was nice, though not particularly memorable, but overall it was an interesting experience.

Our experience had been pleasant food-wise and service-wise. The food was sent to our table quick and the quality was amazing; eating next to the road is a nice touch as well. I recommend trying out their Pho choices, especially the Chicken Shiitake Meatballs one.
This is great street food. Right on the street up it self. Stunning pho here in the top ten great price all under 100k . Great place if you want go get in with locals way of doing stuff.

Best pho we‚Äôve eaten in our 3 weeks being in Vietnam. Arrived early in Saigon, looking for pho and stopped here. We had the beef pho, which was delightful. The lovely lady served it with all the condiments. We enjoyed it looking out onto the morning streets. 10/10 pho, Cam on <3

0x31752f22105e19b3:0x80627d765acbf473.comment: Because I saw a few ‚Äúit is just average‚Äù comments, I actually had this as the last spot of my trip and not having any hopes up. But this turned out to be the best Pho I‚Äôve tried in Saigon, the broth is so savory full of beef flavor, the hot stone with wagyu is a must to taste plus the condiments really work well here than in other places, the chili sauce tasted so good for dipping meat. Right, Get extra meat balls too, this just tops the experience.

Just a decent bowl of pho here. Large space that is bright and clean and not too hot. It is nice to be able to see the kitchen and watch them assemble the bowls. The noodles were good, and the flank cuts were both good, but the brisket and oxtail were quite chewy and not particularly flavorful. The broth was adequate, but nothing particularly special. For the price, expected more.

One of the best Pho restaurants I had been so far.

I went here many times and never had any issue. Some of the reviews are very odd and I believe it's roasting from other companys. Some people give 1 star review in total but  say food 5* and Ambiente 5*  and service 1* so how can the total be 1 star then ?

You can see your Pho bowl been freshly made while you take a look through the glass window inside the shop. They also make the noodles fresh which isn't common at restaurants nowadays. The noodles therefore taste very fresh.

It's literally make your own pho. You get the base plus many herbs, vegetables and sauces to combine .

You can also order some drinks if you want I paid 95k for everything you see on the picture . The herbs are complementary.

Their soup tastes MSG only üòÖüòÖ, Vietnamese people normally don‚Äôt use MSG but this restaurant use too much. I felt thirsty after eating this.

Their sweet is so sweet with MSG üò™üò™I will never order again
Nice and spacious restaurant. Currently the nicest Pho i have tried in HCM because i still prefer Pho in Hanoi. Do order the hot stone bowl.

The young team is amazingly nice, fast and efficient. One of them reserved me their super cool staff teeshirt for the day after.

The food is incredible, probably one of my best pho ever.

**TLDR: 2/10 rating. Worst ph·ªü in 6 months while living in Saigon. Maybe everyone else of the many reviews got way better, but what I received was brutal‚Ä¶ especially for ‚Ç´100k**

I had the ‚ÄúC5‚Äù - ‚ÄúPh·ªü Th·ªë ƒê√°‚Äù - beef shank, well done flank, oxtail & beef ribs

‚Äî

Local Vietnamese don‚Äôt use Google reviews much, so this scathing criticism is to help tourists who consider visiting here.

For me, good ph·ªü has good broth and good meat, and this had neither. A first for me eating ph·ªü in Mexico, the US and 6 months here in Vietnam.

- broth lacked character, richness and nuance‚Ä¶ unlike SO many other bowls of ph·ªü here in Saigon, and they‚Äôre all 1/2 the price of this ‚Ç´100k tragedy in a bowl

- meat pieces were chewy and nearly flavorless

PROS:
- Hot stone bowl
- Air-conditioning
- House-made noodles, but the benefit of rice noodles made in-house is far less than with Italian style pasta
- Qu·∫©y - if you want this (breadsticks)

CONS:
- Bland, flavorless broth
- Small portion of chewy, low-quality beef

100% I do **not** recommend.

There‚Äôs TOO much amazing food in Saigon to settle for insipid, no-love, bland ph·ªü.

You know the ph·ªë here is good if majority of the customers are local. They came here for the freshly made  wide Pho noodles and yes the noodle was pretty good. Don't order the stone pot Pho, look around and see what the locals order and you'll see hardly anyone orders the stone pot Pho. Just order the regular Pho. Plus Pho are made with piping hot broth anyways so the broth is already really hot when you get it. So why would you want it boiling when you get your Pho. I would recommend this place if you like wide pho noodles.

0x31752f3fe8f7e83d:0xc9d55225beeb91f.comment: It's Ph·ªü restaurant. There were so many people there. I think it's popular for both Vietnamese and tourists because of the location. It's south style Pho. Then it's very standard Pho. The items on the table were enough and the Pho is good. So I was satisfied with it. The price wa normal as the location, so It's good Pho restaurant.

Between two, we ordered the Tai (Rare steak), Nam (beef lean meat) as well as one coconut. The broth was full of flavour and with the coconut, I was in heaven! One star deducted as I did find the serving size quite small despite ordering the large size for both.

It tastes good. However the broth tastes too strong that I suspect those are too much MSG which caused me so thirsty.
And the portion was very small. The picture showed I ordered the ‚Äúlarge‚Äù size which has only a slice of beef.  So the small size only has half?

Also they charged the fee for the tea. Just a small money, but not feeling good for such ‚Äúextra‚Äù fee

Recommended by hotel staff to try out this noodle shop. The staff was very friendly and one of them was helping me with the menu. I get a bit greedy and order a special bowl of rice noodle mixed with oxtail, tendon, and brisket, along with durian smoothies. It was really satisfying ü´†ü´†

I ate here 3 times in 2 days. Would not really recommend ‚Äúph·ªü b√≤ vi√™n‚Äù (beef meatball ph·ªü) since the portion felt small to me and it only came with beef meatballs (well unless you really love meatballs), but I do recommend the full option with the bone - it‚Äôs way better. Soup broth is the best here, could say it‚Äôs perfect balance. Then the bone part and shank. Better than Ph·ªü Ho√†, imo.

I had a Phu at this place during my visit to Ho Chi Minh City. I had a bowl of Phu for my lunch. Portion size was really good and heavy. It tasted really good. Restaurant staff had English speaking staff. Spacious. Little bit crowded during the lunch time but it was fine. Good restaurant to have an authentic Vietnamese Phu in Saigon. Recommended.

Had a pleasant bowl of southern pho here. Soup was beefy and meats are generally very soft except the tendons that were rather chewy. The beef ball was crunchy in texture. I like it that in Ho Chi Minh all kinds of condiments are provided for you to adjust your soup to your taste. Price was fair for the quality you get
Reasonable price, delicious pho, sweet juice. I only eat here when I want to eat pho.

0x31752f53c8b37ffd:0x8b2147a6b458d22f.comment:
- Reasonably priced yet rich & flavorful pho! Love that they serve everything fresh here, beef flanks were soooo soft and tender (try to add some Cholimex for that extra kick üå∂Ô∏è)
- Small-sized resto but did not feel cramped since it was evenly spaced out ~ they even have free wi-fi
- If you‚Äôre looking for some authentic Vietnamese cuisine, try to check out Pho Ong Cat if you‚Äôre in District 1 üáªüá≥
- Staffs are nice and accommodating ~ happy to refill fresh sides

you can always trust a Singaporean when it comes to good food and this pho is beyond excellent! flavourful broth with generous meat portion, especially if you are into beef tendons. was contemplating to go for my second bowl but the soup was too delicious I kept going. will definitely visit again during my trip. also its open 24/7 which is amazing

We had an amazing experience at Ph·ªü √îng C√°t Gia Truy·ªÅn. The food was absolutely authentic and full of flavor ‚Äî some of the best ph·ªü we've had! The location is very convenient, easy to find, and perfect for a quick stop or a relaxed meal.

Prices are fair and totally worth it for the quality you get. The staff were super friendly, welcoming us like regulars and making sure everything was perfect.

We noticed both locals and foreigners enjoying their meals, which says a lot. It‚Äôs clear this place has earned its great reputation.

Highly recommend this spot ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

I had a bowl of pho at Ph·ªü √îng C√°t today and it was excellent. The broth is flavorful, the beef is tender, and the space feels clean and welcoming. A really good choice if you are in the area.

By the way, just a short walk from here there is a coin laundromat called DAN‚ÄôS Wash & Stay at 185/10 Pham Ngu Lao. You can start your laundry there, come enjoy your meal at Ph·ªü √îng C√°t, and by the time you finish eating your clothes will be fresh and ready to pick up.

Ordered Pho All (as I didn‚Äôt know which one to try) but it was very delicious and had all the options - chicken, beef, etc. My cousin ordered Com Bittet Trung and it was also tasty. Owner and cook was also very attentive especially as we don‚Äôt know how to use the herbs. Highly recommend- I love the broth and taste!

This must be the best Pho place ever! I have had pho in HCMC, in Danang, in Hanoi, in Sapa. For me, personally, this is the best one yet! Found this restaurant during my last visit last year and now just had to come back! Certainly recommending to friends and family too! I had ‚ÄúPho All‚Äù which includes almost all types of beef. Love it! And goes very well with Sugarcane juice! You have to try this. Service is great too!

We went to eat there last night with our whole family. Overall, the meat tasted good, but we thought the soup was too sweet. The day before, we had noodles with the Michelin Star, and we felt that their soup tasted better. But that‚Äôs not really a problem ‚Äî every restaurant has its own recipe. That‚Äôs just our personal opinion.

However, what really disappointed me was that I think it was the owner‚Äôs daughter who came to collect the payment. The total was 505,000 VND, and I gave her 1,000,000 VND, but I was shortchanged by 90,000 VND. I never thought a restaurant like this would cheat even on the change. I went back to ask for the receipt again to double-check the prices because something didn‚Äôt feel right. The girl must have realized her mistake because she quickly came over, tapped me, and gave me the missing 90,000 VND.

We visit Ho Chi Minh City every year and feel that the country has developed a lot, with much less cheating nowadays. But I didn‚Äôt expect this kind of thing to still happen in a restaurant. I felt really disappointed.
100% best pho I had in Vietnam. They're very liberal with the portions. It was a great vibe. I'll be back

0x317529b52c7a10c5:0xa22c318400bd3495.comment: First time here and had a blast. Was told to try the photine. Was a bit skeptical but it works! Really nice combo of the fries and pho bo ingredients. The ragutine was even tastier, with some more sauce blending all the flavors and going well with the fries texture. Size L is pretty large.

It's Pho restaurant. I knew that it's kinda popular but I didn't know that it has been slelected as Michelin Bib Gourmand. Actually the Pho that they serve was really good. The price was also not expensive as of the place. Also the staff speak English and their service was really good. They didn't advertise as Michelin Bib Gourmand. I really like it.

Is this best hangover food, eva? üòç I love local fusion food - beef pho-tine and delicious fried chicken. Awesome little restaurant near Pham Viet Chanh. Highly recommend to go all-in on the big serve ü§™üòã

Good pho with rich, aromatic broth and fresh herbs. Portions are generous and service is fast. Prices are a bit higher than average, but the quality makes up for it. A solid choice if you're craving a comforting bowl of pho in a clean, relaxed setting.

This is one of the best meals I‚Äôve ever eaten in Vietnam, and is definitely my favourite spot for Pho Xao. Here they have the option to have it with crispy noodles, and for me they were absolutely perfect. It is definitely deserving of being on the Michelin guide, unlike many other spots.

The flavour of the gravy on the beef is amazing, and the accompanying homemade sauces on the table are delicious. Especially the chilli oil, which is slightly citrusy. I literally scraped the plate clean it was so delicious.

This is somewhere I would happily return to, and honestly say if you‚Äôre in Ho Chi Minh - then it is a MUST VISIT.

As it‚Äôs family owned, the vibe is also super friendly. They‚Äôre also very proud of what they‚Äôve built which is nice to see. The owner lady even gave us some free cake, which was the lightest fluffiest cake I‚Äôve ever had - so she‚Äôs a great cook and baker!!

Definitely go here, and try the Pho Xao , it‚Äôs a must. Can‚Äôt wait to try everything else on the menu

I eat pho back home at least once a week. This place is a must go if you are in Ho Chi Minh. The owner and staff are so nice! Broth is so delicious. Trust me go if you can! I can‚Äôt believe this place has negative reviews. They treat you like family.

Decided to go to this side of the city to find Pho Chao from my friend‚Äôs recommendation.

Pho was excellent and the fried rice also top! We will come back to try more dishes :)

Food @bredgyeats for more follow posts!

It's Ph·ªü restaurant, which was selected as "Selected" by Michelin. Actually I visited here long time ago but I cannot remember how they were, so I tried again. Quick, Authentic, but Missing the Punch

The pho comes with a generous helping of lime, bean sprouts, and herbs‚Äîdefinitely a nice touch. That said, the broth leaned on the milder side for me. I have had pho that tend to be more aromatic and herb-forward, I found myself missing that fragrant depth.

I ordered the mixed beef large bowl, but was a bit underwhelmed‚Äîonly one piece of each meat type, which left the bowl feeling more noodle-heavy than expected. Still, the portion of noodles was fair, and the overall bowl warm and comforting.

The space itself feels authentic, clean
, with open fans circulating air and adding to the relaxed, street-side vibe. It‚Äôs not the most flavorful pho I‚Äôve had, but for speed and simplicity, it definitely delivers.

Verdict: 3.5/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è, could have definitely be a 4 if the pho was bigger in portion for the ‚Äúlarge‚Äù size and more fragrant!

0x31752fba354e2425:0xa794a1a48ee7a0ca.comment:
I ordered the C2 hot-stone beef pho, which comes with raw beef slices and cooked beef brisket. On the side you get beef broth, scallions, bean sprouts, lemongrass, Thai basil, and fresh chili.
The taste is very close to the classic pho I‚Äôve had before. The stone bowl arrives piping hot, so you can cook the raw beef yourself, almost like a mini hot pot. Don‚Äôt rush it the way I did‚Äîif you add all the beef at once, it clumps together. Take your time and swish the slices in the broth for the best texture.
The fresh chili is seriously spicy, so add with care. The chili sauce on the table packs heat too. The broth here is noticeably fresher and a touch sweeter than what I‚Äôve had in Europe, and it tastes far less like MSG. European pho really does cut corners on slow-simmered stock.
Overall, this bowl beats any pho I‚Äôve tried in Europe or Japan. I can‚Äôt compare it to local Vietnamese spots since this is the only one I‚Äôve tried so far, but I‚Äôll definitely explore more next time. The shop itself is small, clean, and welcoming, with plenty of foreign visitors. Both card and cash are accepted.

So delicious, it‚Äôs so flavorful and the meat is so tender. I like the meatball so much, it doesn‚Äôt taste like anywhere else.

This gives you the authentic feel of Pho, easy to eat and unique in Vietnam. This place is a great start to try the dish.

Service is so topnotch. They‚Äôre very helpful and can also speak my language, they‚Äôre so friendly!!!

You should try the crispy bread dip in the soup.. so good.

Taste ‚Äì Like I mentioned, my first encounter with pho was disappointing, but this place completely changed my perspective. This is what authentic pho really is. As a fellow Southeast Asian, I absolutely loved it‚Äîthe meat, the noodles, and especially the broth. Even now, I‚Äôm already missing it as I write this!

Absolutely incredible pho! Hands down the best I‚Äôve ever had in Vietnam. The broth was rich, flavorful, and perfectly balanced, with fresh ingredients that made every bite a delight. The service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming. Highly recommend this place to anyone craving authentic, top-notch pho! I‚Äôll definitely be back!

Pho in hot stone bowl. Fun to cook beef by myself. I ordered Pho Tho Da C2. Soup was tasty, beef soft and no smell. Love the crispy dough with the soup. Nice price, also free Wi-Fi

0x31752f3fb0b08a91:0x63e50be8d0cf2096.comment: prob my most fav Pho in Saigon. disclaimer - im from Hanoi so my tastebuds are more attuned to Hanoi-style Pho. if you love clean (and prob msg-infused) over sweet broth thats characteristically Southern, this is def your go to spot. unlike many restos which modify their self proclaimed Northern Pho to better suit Southern tastes and give me major letdowns bc of their false marketing, Pho Vi lives up to their branding. owners are true blue Hanoian so thats extra authenticity points for you. if you find this Pho lackluster, chances are that Southern Pho will be more to your liking.

Yes, it‚Äôs rough and ready ‚Äì the d√©cor hasn‚Äôt changed since 1972 and the floor may or may not be slippery with flavour ‚Äì but that‚Äôs the charm. The broth? Deep. The b√≤ vi√™n? Bouncy. The service? Efficient in the way only aunties who have run the same stall since the war can be.

And the clientele? Everyone from suited-up office folk to confused backpackers with Lonely Planet PDFs open on their phones. It's always busy, and rightfully so ‚Äì because unlike the sterile chain restaurants creeping across Saigon, this place has soul. And possibly a family of ghosts in the wall tiles.

Eat here while you still can. When the lovely elderly folks who run it hang up their aprons, it‚Äôs unlikely their Gen Z grandchildren will trade TikTok for tendon. Ph·ªü this good is on borrowed time.Get your bowl. Get your fix. Pay cash or QR code. No nonsense.

Nestled in a quaint alley on Ho Hao Hon Street in District 1, Pho Ngoc offers an authentic Vietnamese dining experience that stands out in Ho Chi Minh City. From the moment you arrive, the warmth and hospitality of the owner and staff make you feel right at home.

The star of the menu is undoubtedly their pho. The broth is rich and flavorful, a testament to the time-honored preparation methods employed in the kitchen. It‚Äôs so delectable that I found myself savoring every last drop, finishing the entire bowl‚Äîa rarity in my culinary adventures.

Pho Ngoc is primarily open for breakfast, making it an ideal spot to start your day with a hearty meal. The setting is modest, embodying the essence of local street food culture, which only adds to its charm. Despite its simplicity, the quality of the food rivals that of more renowned establishments in the city.

Whether you‚Äôre a local or a traveler, a visit to Pho Ngoc promises not just a meal, but a memorable experience filled with genuine hospitality and some of the best pho Saigon has to offer.

i love the pho here

Really good Pho Bo! Big bowl and very tasty. Only locals here!

There're plenty Pho restos in Saigon with the Saigon taste ( not Hanoian Taste)
but I find this Pho one of the best for quality control and authenticity.
Unlike in Hanoi where you could find almost similar quality in ... most Pho restos because of their secret formula of Pho has not been the secret to Hanoian no more. "You are not called Hanoian if you can not cook Pho".
Here in Saigon there's a little special touch to each of different Pho places you visit... one that will remain the secret for their family only.
If you count on the fingers how many best Saigonese Pho restaurants, this particular branch of Pho Hung on this very address could be in my top 5.
Come here at least once to know exactly how Saigonese Pho should be from a real Saigonese point of view.

I‚Äôve been here a lot so it may be due to the glass door being propped open. In any case, the food is worth coming here for but don‚Äôt expect this place to be perfectly clean.
If you want to try local Pho, traditional flavour. This place is not a good option.

Hands down one of the best and tastiest Pho Noodles in Vietnam with a few Michelin Star awards.

The Vietnamese ice coffee's are really good and sooo refreshing and the food is excellent and has a bit of a home style vibe, the owner is delightful and the service was great and friendly.

The Beef and Brisket Pho Noodles with beef balls was precisely what I needed after a long week especially the Pho in particular has an excellent, clean and northern style broth.

We came in with no expectations and walked away with full bellies and an unforgettable experience.

I would highly recommend this amazing place to anyone and if you‚Äôre in Ho Chi Minh City you must visit this amazing place Ph·ªü L·ªá.

The food is acceptable, nothing special.
