I've been to three of the most well-known pho restaurants, including Pho Le, Pho Hoa, and Pho Quynh, and this place was the best for me. I went here around 9 a.m., and there was no waiting. The soup had a rich, meaty flavor and aroma, but it was not unpleasant. I'd go to this place every week if it were near my house.
I am puzzled over the negative review!! This is a perfect mixed beef pho!! You get all the flavor in!! It is crowded with local!! It ain‚Äôt touristy!! Maybe it is due to the 30 mins taxi ride!!
It‚Äôs ok‚Ä¶ the broth is on a sweat side which I don‚Äôt really like . So far the best Pho I ate were in Pho Viet Nam district 1 .

I had dinner here at 8pm on 8/10/25. Order various pho for my family of four, myself had a rare beef and brisket pho. The stock was bland to the point of watery, rare beef was OK, brisket was extremely undercooked and was very chewy. While we were very hungry, none of us could finish our bowl, it was the worst beef noodle I ever had for years, to the point that I am confident if this restaurant is in a Viet area in Sydney, it would be out of business in months. To make the experience worst, the waiters were talking loudly, using language like a bunch of holidays.
I am amazed at how Le made it into the Michelin guide, and seems to be quite popular with the local. Just to put things in perspective, I am a Viet Aussie in Sydney, where good Pho restaurants are in abundant.
Thr best pho I've tried in Saigon! Broth was so flavorful and thrle pho has a lot of meat. The meatballs are very meaty and not soft.

A renowned restaurant that's been established for more than 70 years, Pho Le is a traditional pho restaurant takes focuses on Southern Style pho. The tables are clean and staff are friendly towards tourist. In relation to the food, the broth is heavy, sweet and full of various spices. The Pho Dac Biet contains one of the most generous amount of beef slices - with thick cuts and crunchy tendons. There are also a large plate of fresh herbs that come on the side as well. If you want to enjoy a traditional Southern Style pho, and want to step away from the relatively busier District 1 - I highly recommend you to visit and also try the egg with beef soup. üëçüòã

0x31752f04ec5d8e79:0x384401e60e064091.comment: Arrived in HCM late, and was lucky to find this place close to our hotel! Probably one of if not the best pho I've ever had. What stood out the most was the meat and portions complimented with the rich tasting broth. Compared to Pho Khoi which is basically next door, the soup here falls a bit short but has better meat; both are however top quality pho.

0x31752f0040203303:0xc9cfdcb4c6dabe5d.comment: Cute little store with very cheap food that‚Äôs so tasty. Spoke to the owner and they‚Äôre only a week old so don‚Äôt be dissuaded by the lack of reviews. It‚Äôs a very lovely clean store.

The food is so good. We had our Banhmi toasted. The place is ig worthy and you can borrow the hats and umbrella. Auntie is very accommodating , friendly and always smiling. Will definitely go here again.

Loved my bahn mi from here, it's just round the corner from where I stayed. The girl that served me was very polite, well mannered, and enthusiastic.
I had the beef bahn mi, the sauce was exceptionally good.
Its my first rst Bahn mi in Vietnam...and loved it. The service also very nice. Its a newly opened place and the owner herself serving the guests.

I went many times here and I love it! The bread is absolutely delicious, warm and the right amount of crispy. The filling is perfect, they don't put too much meat or pat√© like other places. The team is super lovely, I enjoy their banh mi and supporting them :)
Crispy bread! Nothing like the others ive tried and the lady is most hospitable, always smiling and accommodating:)

Tried this little banh mi spot in Saigon and was blown away! Rolls packed full of flavour, crunchy on the outside and soft inside. The green rice mayo and sweet taro mayo are sooo special I‚Äôve never seen these anywhere else and they work so well with the fillings.

The lovely owner makes each one with love you can taste it üëçüèª
Perfect bread. Best in the town. Highly recommend.

0x31752f08f74359b5:0x7b7840c735067b3f.comment: This place is situated just outside Bui vien walking street and is a very busy and popular shop. For such a small spot they do churn out a large some of food. I had the banh mi nem thit nuong, which was packed with meat with generous portions of pate and butter. I also ordered cap banh day, which is essentially steamed mochi as the carp portion of the sandwich and steamed pork. This thing was one of my favorite things to eat growing up in the states.

Found a hair in the salad unfortunately. Gave it to a staff member - not sure if they misunderstood but the same container was brought back to me, still with the hair in it. Sent it back again and was given a replacement container. The banh mi itself was a big serving size with generous fillings. Good flavours but the pate was a bit overpowering for my liking.

Is this expensive for a Banh Me? Yes

Is it absolutely massive? Yes

Can you feed a whole African village with one sandwich? Yes

On a serious note, I really do like this place. It offers a huge portion size and for delivery they separate the vegetables so you can choose which ones you add, of course I added everything for the best experience

Ordered their special bread in small size, but it was already filling and satisfying to the heart‚Äôs content! ü•ñ‚ú® Banh Mi is flavorful and hearty, service is great, and they even have a cozy space to enjoy your sandwich with refreshing fruit drinks. Definitely worth a visit!

Banh mi was full with toppings and richly slathered with pate and mayonnaise. It‚Äôs very rich and meaty. A bit too much meat for my taste. The portion was huge, so 2 of us had to share one. Package was nice and clean.

B√°nh m√¨ B√† Hu·ª≥nh (Madam Win) is quite a famous b√°nh m√¨ shop in Saigon, always busy with both delivery drivers and walk-in customers.

ü•ñ The baguette is crispy on the outside and soft inside, with generous fillings ‚Äî rich and flavorful meat, fresh cucumber, herbs, and pickled vegetables. It‚Äôs very filling, and the portion is so big that one person might not even be able to finish it!
ü•¨ My only small drawback is that the pickled vegetables are on the sweet side. Personally, I prefer them more sour as it helps cut through the richness.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ After dining in, we also ordered a couple more to take away for the family, and everyone was satisfied.

üì¶ I was pleasantly surprised by the takeaway packaging. Instead of just paper bags, they use proper boxes, and even separate the herbs and pickled vegetables individually ‚Äî very neat, clean, and thoughtful.

üí∞ Small size is 50,000 VND, big size is 75,000 VND. Considering the District 1 location, portion, and packaging, I think the price is reasonable.

Overall, it‚Äôs a very good b√°nh m√¨ experience. Definitely worth trying if you‚Äôre nearby! üçûüåøü•í

A big banh mi filled with good stuff. The bread is so crunchy and the fillings come with variety of deliciousness. One Banh mi can keep me full almost the whole day. Yummy üòã It‚Äôs my 2nd time here, will come back more.

This Banh Mi shop is an absolute hidden gem! Everything here is homemade ‚Äì from the crispy p√¢t√© to the fresh pickles ‚Äì and you can taste the love in every bite. The special bread is uniquely fluffy and crispy at the same time, better than any other Banh Mi place. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic street food with exceptional quality, this is a must-visit!

It is my second visit here. The bahn mi is really good. We had the grilled pork one and it tastes fresh ! We also highly recommend the matcha coconut, it‚Äôs really really amazing.

The banh mi here is absolutely delicious! The bread is perfectly crispy, and the filling is flavorful and satisfying. The staff are friendly, and helpful. The place is clean and comfortable. I will definitely come back again. Truly deserves 5 stars!‚Äù

Visited on 20 Aug evening, when I told the stall owner that I would like the 45k vnd banh mi, I was only charged 40k vnd. Anyway is a win for me, I just take it üòÑ

Banh mi is good though, the pork floss helps to add to the flavour. The size is also quite large and filling.

Omg, really underrated roadside stall banh mi. Was feeling hungry late at night and searched on Google map and found this to be nearest to me. Had a try and omg no regrets. Best near midnight snack ever for 50k dong. Will repeat nightly üòÑ

I was looking for banh mi the "most famous banh mi' shop actually. But they have closed after 10pm. Desperately looking for supper, then I come across this road side Banh Mi stall and decided to give it a try.
Surprisingly, the quality of Banh Mi of this stall is so nice and the price is almost half. Just 40k. The famous stall selling 73k...
And most importantly, this stall is open untill midnight, which you can have it as supper.
The location of this stall is just located beside the roundaabout and its just a small stall.
Definitely worth a try if you looking for banh mi midnight.
Good job, boss.
One of my go-to places for b√°nh m√¨. The filing and price are just right. However, i would rather skip the shredded chicken for it is too sweet and go easy with the pate.
My favourite evening pit stop for tasty b√°nh mi. The nice lady working the trolly is helpful in getting you set with what you want. Great food at a great price.  What more could you ask for?

Original of Banh Mi Huynh Hoa.
This is first owned of her father. Now owned by her brother who made unique Pate
Cheap and good quality

Banh Mi became a staple food for us during our Vietnam stay as it was filling & easy to carry. So we had it in 4 different places in Hanoi, Hoi An & Ho Chi Minh City, including the famous B√°nh MiÃÄ Ph∆∞·ª£ng. I have no doubts that the Mix Banh we had at Banh Mi Oanh was best of the bunch. The filling, which had both pork & chicken, was plentiful. Along with usual sauces, sprinkle of pieces of hot chillies added an extra punch. An extremely good deal for price of 35k VND. She was also thoughtful enough to make separate packing for one chicken only bread that we had packed.

Best Banh Mi! We shared their cheapest one at 40,000 VND, and it was excellent. They set up their cart at about 7 pm, and as soon as they rolled up, people were lining up, waiting for them to be ready. Mmmmmmm

0x31752fd242a96f7b:0x73eaee4cfc5b4843.comment: You know it'll be good when there are 5 grabs waiting for orders. Maybe a little heavy on the mayo but an amazingly delicious chicken banh mi. Would recommend!
i love their banh mi rolls! good portion, fresh ingredients, and the pork bits are just perfect. the baguette is always fresh, warm and crispy. we had this twice in a week cuz we love it so much
Ordered this on Grab and this was probably my favourite bahn mi of the trip. Generous amount of shredded chicken and great taste!

Standard banh mi. Not elite level so it gets a 4 stars - still great compared to America. We did pay 30-35k VND for one and the combo is a bit confusing (comes with coke or some kind of tea in a bag option).

Coke was 15,000 VND. We came here bc our place was around the corner and though we liked the smaller food stall across the street, this one is nearly as good.

Tasty Banh MI. Tried both the pork and chicken, and I can't decide which I liked more. Both were delicious. There was a little bit of a line at lunch time, but they were able to dish out sandwiches quickly and move the line along. You can tell it's a popular spot. Lots of food delivery services picking up sandwiches too.

FOOD & DRINKS
I obviously had to try the banh mi, which was decent. For a Vietnamese baguette with grilled meat, I always prefer the meat coming straight off the BBQ.

SERVICE
The guy who took orders was really nice and friendly. The banh mi was served quick.

ATMOSPHERE
What I think most tourists will like is that this food stall looks clean compared to other banh mi food stalls while not being much more expensive.

RATING
Its just that with some street banh mi, they pack so much more flavour when the meat is hot and fresh while not being more expensive.

The pork was really tasty and tender, although there was a bit too much mayonnaise in my opinion
There was a wet tissue and a toothpick attached to the sandwich bag, which was very considerate

I bought the combo(and it was around 18:30-40, not 20:00 when I wrote this post!) from this shop and THIS HAPPENED. It ruined my food and my clothes and my room!

Once I opened the coke, it EXPLODED so powerfully that my 25 sqm room is literally covered with coke stains. The explosion was so thorough that I could even find all the stains scattered everywhere. It will be swarmed with ants soon.

Most importantly, it almost ruined my laptop. Pity I couldn‚Äôt take the picture my laptop was all covered in coke. I was so urgent!

Trust me - I didn't shake the bottle on the way. My place is just 3 minutes away and I'm extra careful whenever I carry soda. Staffs there must have shaken and dumped the bottle all around - that's the only explanation. Otherwise it couldn't have ended up the biggest soda explosion I've ever seen.

Just DON‚ÄôT buy the combo menu here. No, just DON‚ÄôT buy anything. I could guess how they would handle other ingredients as well.

Located inside The Manufacture Countryside complex. It‚Äôs a block that have few restaurants inside. The concept is food truck food.

Banh mi taste is good. The price is good. You can ask the waitress in English.

It‚Äôs contained pork in few menus.

They also sell some kinds of local art craft. You can buy for gift.

Can you even say you‚Äôve been to Vietnam and not have had an iconic Banh Mi sandwich? This place is a gem and highly recommend if you are in District 1 in Saigon (HCMC). It is tucked away and not obvious from the street. Look for El Gaucho‚Äôs steakhouse, and it is next to it. Lots of filling options (though my default is pork), and the bread is amazing. They can make spicy or not. Wash it down with a Vietnamese ice coffee and you‚Äôll have a great lunch and experience a prime example of this iconic sandwich.

The restaurant makes each bain mi sandwich to order, so the bread is crispy and the meat inside is savory and delicious.
Even if you take your bahn mi sandwich home, I'll keep coming back because the taste is as good as ever.

Great little food truck style Banh Mi place. Hidden away (you have to go through a walkway that is not easy to find). Maps took me to the other side, which is not accessible, go around the block to the other side to find the entrance.

I ordered a Banh Mi 74 'signature' and it's absolutely delicious, crunchy outside and yummy inside with a combination of different classic Vietnamese banh mi ingredients. They have tables in front so you can sit down and enjoy your banh mi.

The only pity about this place is the decor and presentation say nothing about 'we sell delicious banh mi here'. You don't even see banh mi. I was curious where they make these yummy banh mi and found out the whole very nice restaurant standard kitchen  next door cooking studio, same owner.

This place was an absolutely amazing find! The staff was extremely friendly, and the food was out of this world. The bread was so perfect it could make any sandwich good. The freshness of everything and quality is like nothing I have ever found in the US. The tea is also unmatched. I may have to eat here everyday until I leave.
Hands down one of the best Banh Mi I ever had in my life. I ordered extra pork for my banh mi and worth every penny. Cute little place with amazing food and service. Drop by if you‚Äôre nearby.

Bahn Mi was a little dearer than we have been used to but it it tucked away near the five star hotels in Saigon and it presents exceptionally well. Teas and coffees were delicious and the Bahn mi was very very good. We enjoyed char su pork and char su chicken and there was a pizza option for those in the family who are over Bahn mi. Great service and a lovely place to sit through laneway surrounded by upmarket restaurants.

Our first dinner/supper after our landing on 18 Oct 2025.

This banh mi superb delicious üòã and good. Crispy bread and fresh veggies and mint üòã
Cold coffee also best. The lime üçã beverages go well with banh mi.

Kept going back for our dinners. Not sick eating vegan banh mi. Thank you friendly staff for recognise us. Your banh mi really nice.

This was my first meat during my recent trip to Vietnam via landing in HCMC. Good decision as this really made me full!

I ordered the vegan premium banh mi and also the black sugar bubble nut milk tea.

The banh mi was the thickest, most filling and largest one I had throughout my entire trip! Had vegan meat, tofu, lettuce, basil, tomatoes. Really good banh mi, and definitely one of the best places to get vegan banh mi in the city! Although it is a bit more ‚Äòpricier‚Äô than other vegan banh mi in the city/the standard price in general. But still worth it.

The bubble tea I had was ok, but as dairy-free option isn‚Äôt widely available for bubble tea (I think), it‚Äôs great to find a vegan option here. I found the tapioca pearls to be a bit medium hard than chewy and soft.

Seating was mostly indoors. Suitable for 1-3 people in a group.
We have been here 3 times because it was that good. The staff is more than friendly and the food was great. It‚Äôs nice to eat vegan and the drinks are great. Best Banh Mi in town :)
Bahn Mi Xanh, Ho Chi Minh would have to be the best ever! This place is just a small shop front, clean, best tasting vegan and great service. This is a must visit!! 5 star all around
Not a fan of banh mi in general, nothing special about their vegan version. Ok for a quick meal and home delivery if needed.

It is not cheap but the Banh mi is very great! Acceptable. The Banh mi is very big and many toppings inside.

Fantastic banh mi, we had the spicy tofu and premium one and they were both delicious. Thank you and we will come again!
Loved the food and i love that they accept credit cards.. very tourist friendly

0x31752f001b5a825d:0xac5755fcc41e6202.comment: A very tiny takeaway store with the most unusual banh mi I have ever seen. The sizes are quite large - even the small sandwiches are a pretty hefty size. The young rice spread is sweet, savory, and very rich. It‚Äôs delicious. Service was fast and Theres a bit of space for motorbike parking available on the sidewalk.

"A unique b√°nh m√¨," they said. Sure, on paper it is. But if you were to blindfold me and ask me to tell a difference between this and any other cold-cut b√°nh m√¨, I wouldn't be able to tell.

I went early morning to grab one for breakfast so there was no wait. The prices seem to have gone up slightly for everything. The small is now 38K & the large is 59K. Honestly, the prices are not bad for how big the portion sizes are. The small is bigger than the average b√°nh m√¨ you'd find in most street stalls & is more than enough (or even a little too much) for the average Vietnamese' appetite.

Taste-wise, however, it was a bit of a letdown. Was it bad by any means? No. In fact, I found it quite solid... as any other solid cold-cut b√°nh m√¨ you'd find out there in HCMC (which are plenty). Its one advertised unique aspect, the c·ªëm butter, absolutely did not come through at all, not even a hint, when eaten together with everything else as a whole sandwich. The pate was the dominant flavor. When I tried the c·ªëm butter on its own, it tasted like the pork floss that was directly placed on top of it instead. Speaking of which, their pork floss was really good & apparently they have 2 kinds, a regular and a fried-shallots one which you have to specifically request since they don't tell you about it lol

Now, I ordered the regular b√°nh m√¨ without adding anything extra so I thought maybe the problem would be solved if you ordered extra c·ªëm butter. However, someone I know ordered theirs with extra butter and they still had the exact same experience except they could actually taste the nice c·ªëm flavor when they tried just the butter on its own. What I'm gathering from that is that maybe the best way to experience this unique c·ªëm butter on a b√°nh m√¨ is to just get it separately on its own and put it on a plain b√°nh m√¨ and enjoy.

For the price and the portion size, I wasn't mad at what I got. I would probably revisit just to do the hack I mentioned. But if you're hoping to experience a cool gimmicky b√°nh m√¨ like me, this isn't worth it. Again, it's not bad, just nothing special.

Banh mi Bo Com - banh mi with pandan spread. Really good but it is a TAKE AWAY ONLY spot. He did not allow us to eat there. We walked to Namoo Coffee down the street and enjoyed our banh mi there. Namoo serves great drinks and friendly atmosphere
The 55k sandwich is incredibly big. Eating it feels like I'm full for the entire day. It's delicious, with a rich and creamy butter and young rice flavor. The toppings are absolutely overflowing!
very interesting gimmick for banh mi. portion is huge. definitely a must-try!

Went yesterday & was very impressed.

Very friendly staff. I got a small for 35k which is a great deal as these are stuffed & bigger than most.

Great value, I will return as this is right by our office.

0x31752f416b348db5:0xf0a1ac863e3e378e.comment: Local diner near wet market. Staff can't speak English but are very friendly. Food was served fast and hot. Bahn mi filling may look too few but pressing the bread flat is the key (personal preference).

I loved their reasonably priced, no-nonsense, delicious and hearty bahn mi. The store offers a variety of vietnamese and chinese products including meats, pastries and various dishes. Its located just across the back area of Bitexco Building in District 1.

They have other local dish such as Com Tam as well.

We stopped here to get out of the rain. And I'm so glad that we did. We both had a BBQ Banh Mi which is delicious. I had an orange and mango juice. Freshly squeezed. And Wendy had iced lemon.

So disappointed that my favourite place - a go to place for banh mi had come to the end. I bought banh mi and snack for my late night super.
It was smelly due to the pickled veggie, the meat was not fresh anymore so I discarded it.
The shredded dried beef...tasteless and quite expensive for such a small portion.
No longer Nhu lan for me.

Today, I had a chance to try the famous Banh Mi Nhu Lan, and it did not disappoint! I ordered two types of sandwiches: the fresh baguette with braised pork and the fresh baguette with xiu mai (Vietnamese meatballs). Both were delicious and left a strong impression. The fresh baguette was soft and chewy, providing a perfect base for the flavorful fillings.

The braised pork was tender and well-seasoned, melting in my mouth with each bite. It paired beautifully with the fresh bread, making every bite rich and satisfying. The xiu mai, on the other hand, had a delightful savory taste with a hint of sweetness, just the way it should be. Each xiu mai meatball was juicy, tender, and full of flavor.

Prices here are reasonable for the quality; the fresh baguettes are 40,000 VND, while the regular baguettes are 30,000 VND. Both options offer great value for a delicious and filling meal.

Overall, Banh Mi Nhu Lan lives up to its reputation. With fresh ingredients, balanced flavors, and a fair price, this place is a must-visit for any Banh Mi lover. The variety and quality make it worth coming back to explore more flavors!

We‚Äôre by no means banh mi experts, but after trying several spots in Ho Chi Minh City, Grandma Lu was hands down our favorite. So much so that we came back three times during our five-day stay!

The sandwiches are absolutely delicious‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. Our top picks were the Grandma, Pulled Chicken, and Tuna‚Äîeach one packed with bold flavors and the perfect crunch from the baguette.

The shop itself could use a little TLC when it comes to decor, but honestly, that just adds to its charm. At the end of the day, it‚Äôs all about the food, and Grandma Lu delivers in the best way possible. If you‚Äôre in HCMC and craving banh mi, this spot is a must-visit!

Mr Khoi speaks good English and that was helpful. The Vietnamese coffee we ordered with special request for less sweetness was brilliant. No one should leave Vietnam without trying their original Vietnamese coffee in my humblest opinion.

We even ordered some Grandma Lu's Bahn Mi to go to treat the Sotetsu Grand Fresca Hotel front reception staff who recommended us Grandma Lu's Bahn Mi place.

One of the best Bahn mi places I've tried in HCMC. They've a lot of options for meat lovers and was absolutely delighted to find out that they have vegetarian options as well. Follow @bredgyeats for more food posts!

Where there's banh mi, there's savoury sticky rice, and there's little reason not to try both. The fluffy baguette trumps the sticky rice for its subtle sweetness and yeasty aroma it adds to each bite, sandwiching a wonderful balance of ingredients that palates from across the globe have grown to love. The rich savoriness of the meats melded with the mayo, pate, pickled carrots and daikon, cucumbers, and cilantro creates a harmonious experience that's seldom found in Toronto. Sharing many common ingredients like sliced cold cuts and a savoury, rich pate. The addictive glutinous texture serves as an excellent vehicle for the rest of the toppings, too, including a fragrant scallion oil, subtly sweet pork floss, along with crunchy peanuts. I find comfort in knowing great banh mi can be found no matter what district you're in, as this location hits the spot too. It's up to you whether you prefer a coarser, stronger pate and a touch easier on the mayo. The sticky rice even includes Chinese sausage and quail egg.

A banh mi shop with a good reputation around the area (Chinatown, District 5); it has been in business since 1968, and sells over 1000 breads daily. I quite like this banh mi, as it has a nice aroma from the meatballs (x√≠u m·∫°i) inside. Price is good (30K each) and taste is good.

First time trying and it‚Äôs so good.

The meat is salty and smoky, and pairs well with the condiments provided.

Delicious drinks, comfortable seating, free wifi, and a good location.
Lunch Lady is just around the corner.

Atmosphere and cleanliness were looking good. However the taste of bun cha Ha Noi fails and the rest doesn't mean anything to me.

Recommendation : Do not add sugar to meat. Try putting some salt instead of sugar.
I like the open space outside with canal view. Quiet enough to hear your thought and busy enough for watching people from front row. Decent drinks with fair price.
Good service. Taste of Bun Cha is delicious, but easy to find at any other restaurant. I appreciate the cleanliness as well.
Tasty and fresh drink in cozy place. :)
Great place with nice river view. The staff are very friendly and enthusiastic. I will come back there with pleasure üòä

0x31752f1f75a5d6c9:0x31330ea41b7be069.comment: This is a famous Bun Cha store apparently as my queen brought me here for lunch, first proper meal of the day and trip. Very satisfying and delicious! I had a great dining experience at Qu√°n Ngon ‚Äì B√∫n Ch·∫£ H√† N·ªôi. This place is a solid choice for anyone wanting to try authentic northern Vietnamese flavors, especially the famous B√∫n Ch·∫£.

Pros:
‚Ä¢	Authentic taste: The B√∫n Ch·∫£ here was flavorful and satisfying. The grilled pork had a nice smoky aroma, the broth was fresh and well-balanced, and the herbs and noodles were generous and fresh.
‚Ä¢	Local vibe: The restaurant has a simple, clean, and local-style atmosphere. It feels very genuine and relaxed, which adds to the experience.
‚Ä¢	Affordable prices: For the quality of food, the prices are very reasonable. It‚Äôs definitely good value for money.
‚Ä¢	Friendly service: The staff were friendly and tried their best to assist, even though their English was limited. Their helpful attitude made the experience pleasant.

Very good, in a high pace Street.
Kinda small but you can get the local vibe.
The food was very tasty, and the spring rolls were of a decent size and full of flavour...
All the staff attended our needs and were very helpful.
Fast and funny

Best vegetarian meal I had in Ho Chi Minh - I came back again just for it! The bun cha was deliciously fresh with a range of delightful flavours, and the spring rolls that came were crispy and packed! Thank you!!

This is the best Bun Cha in the world! Possibly my favourite meal I had all throughout Vietnam. Super fresh noodles with the most perfectly balanced broth and incredible meat balls. So good we came back twice.

Enjoyed a lovely meal here. The food was fresh and delicious, the service was attentive which made for an enjoyable experience. The vegetarian spring rolls were just so good. Well done on providing a a great place to eat.

Went for lunch on a weekday. It was busy, but I was seated quickly. The staff are helpful. It's a restaurant that caters to tourists, with tourist prices and strong aircon. The menu has pictures and English descriptions. I ordered the special set. It arrived quickly. The meat pieces were tasty. The spring roll was thick and crunchy, but not particularly flavorful. The noodles with the sauce were very good. The leftover sauce was great, I drank it all. Paid with a card.

I am speechless! The food is absolutely delicious, always fresh and tasty! This is my favorite restaurant in Saigon. Hands down, the best bun cha Ha Noi I have ever eaten.
I always end up eating here whenever Im visiting. Staff‚Äôs attitude is always great as wellüòä

Great price and better food.  easily one of my favorite meals in Ho Chi Minh City, this week.  Plan a visit, you will be happy you did!

I took a before and after photo of a dish that is not only very delicious but also simple yet flavorful.

Very good Soup.
We took the Bun Suon Non (Porc) and the Bun Phi le CA and Tom (Fish and Shrimp). Very delicious.
Service was nice.
Would be my morning soup if I am living nearby.
I recommend this small restaurant

Tried broken rice with pork ribs. Pretty okay, it was hard to chew pork, though. Complementary tea was nice. The service was good. Good place for a quick bite, but nothing extraordinary. Prices are very affordable.

Top shelf good at bargain prices ! The bbq pork is fire üí• . It keeps me coming back and half of Ho Chi Min at times !!!

0x31752f73c4de5b2f:0x77a2344273a08a45.comment: Lovely restaurant for lunch. The food is amazing and the portion is reasonable for the price, especially in district 1. The broth is light but got some good fishy taste. The staffs are nice and fast, the place is a bit small with few tables so more suitable for couples. 8.5/10, highly recommend the crunchy fishcake.

We loved everything at The Buns ‚Äì Bun Cha Cha. The food was fresh and flavorful, but the sat√™ sauce was the real highlight. It had the perfect balance of spice and taste, so good that we even bought 2 kilos to take home. The staff were friendly and the place has a cozy vibe. Definitely worth a visit.

I had a fishcake noodle soup, milk coffee, and caramel pudding. Everything tastes ok. I liked the soup. Coffee tasted like 120% sugar even though I requested less sugar, but that's the way it is in Saigon, so everything's still good! Seems like locals who work nearby tend to frequent this place during lunch. Good to try if you're nearby.

Found this place after visiting the history museum. A lovely place, with relaxing vibe.
The Bun Cha is tasty. We ordered the crispy fishcake as snack and we love it too.

A lowkey spot that can be many's comfort food place

This place only serve Central Style Bun Ca (rice vermicelli with fish cake). Rich broth, fresh and spongey fish cake + crunchy fish cake slides, made the bowl feel like a dancing party of taste and texture.

I love the shacha sauce that is slightly sweet, sour, and spicy, paired real well with the already rich broth.

The additional cabbage side dish complements quite well with the bowl of noodle, making the dish whole and nutritious.

I like vibe, it's giving a failed coffee shop turned Noodle place, and they succeed in making that attractive, tasteful bowl of noodle. They didn't focus on the design, more so the food just so you know.

Price is very district 1 (mid-high), but the look of the place, and the portion will justify why.
I highly recommend it for its delicious food and nice service. However, the space is small. Need to avoid rush hours, such as lunchtime

Visited for lunch. Location in alley so will have to walk further down alley. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Ordered fishcake noodle soup for 52k. Very reasonable price with aircon seating. Soup was delicious, very warm and comforting. Would definitely returnüëçüëç

Very comforting good as we just landed in the morning.
Good food.

Wow!!  Best ph∆° I have had in months!!!

Sorry that the picture is of an empty bowl: it was too good to stop eating and photo.

0x31752f776216d891:0x69d47584d9fed9ae.comment: It's Bun Bo Hue Noodle shop, which was selected as "selected" by Michelin. The shop is located on the very small street and you can park your motorbike at next wider street. The shop is very small comparing to the popularity, so you may have a seat with someone. It's quite normal in Vietnam. Anyway the Bun noodle looks very simple and normal, but the soup and meat were really nice. Simply it tastes very good. The price was 45KVND. The value for the price was also really good here.

Very authentic experience, shop was mostly filled with locals. But no issues with ordering because they had a semi English menu ready. Broth was tasty, be sure to add some lime and chilli! The noodles came with a bowl of lard (i think?) and I mimicked the locals by pairing one piece with a big mouth of noodles. Yum!

10/10 ‚Äî hands down the BEST place for B√∫n B√≤ Hu·∫ø. I like to think of myself as a bit of an expert when it comes to this dish, and I had to order a second bowl just to confirm how good it really was. It definitely lives up to its Michelin star from 2024. The space is tight, so expect some heat ‚Äîbut trust me, the food more than makes up for it.

Man this place was packed. I thought the Bun Bo was good. The price is affordable because they give you slightly less meat than other places. They do offer extra fat in a small bowl for more flavor if you can handle it. Not a bad experience but I‚Äôd hate to have to wait to be seated so avoid peak hours.

‚ÄúA must-stop destination for travelers. Though a bit inconvenient and hard to find, this hidden gem is Michelin-selected. The food is excellent, reasonably priced, and absolutely worth the visit. Besides the food, don‚Äôt miss their homemade soy milk ‚Äî it‚Äôs a must-try.‚Äù

The restaurant is tucked away in a small alley, but just follow Google Maps and you‚Äôll find it. Lots of locals eat here, the prices are super cheap, and the food is flavorful. The meat is tender and juicy, and the owner can speak English, which makes ordering easy.
Street food worth to visit. Delicious Bun Bo Hue especially when u add lime and chili oil (be mindful as chili oil so spicy üòÑ)

We had such a wonderful experience here! The place is spotless and very well organized, and the staff are warm and welcoming. We enjoyed our meals so much that we came back twice in two days!

We tried their signature B√∫n Thang C√¥ Ba, B√∫n M·ªçc, and B√∫n Ch·∫£ Gi√≤ Nem ‚Äî each dish was flavorful, fresh, and beautifully presented. The portions are generous, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality you get.

If you‚Äôre looking for authentic, delicious Vietnamese noodle dishes in District 3, this is definitely a must-try spot!

Stumbled across this place looking for a place to have lunch ‚Äî tucked away in an alleyway, don‚Äôt be fooled by it‚Äôs location! I had the Bun Thang Chi Ba and it was phenomenal :-). The food was so hearty and comforting, with great fishballs. For 55K VND it was worth every penny and I would definitely be back on my next trip. Perhaps the best thing I had eaten during my trip to Vietnam ü•∞. Truly a hidden gem üëç

Bun thang is traditionally a northern Vietnamese soup with vermicelli. Even though my mum is from the South, she used to make it all the time so I was really craving it.

The best part about this soup is that it has the scrambled eggs. The broth is clear and flavorful, the shredded chicken, and pork.

I even got an extra side of scrambled eggs.

It hit the spot. They also sell cha gio and nem which sold out when I went but I‚Äôll come earlier next time to get it. I asked the guy normally what time they sell out and he said around 12pm.

The only slight let down is that it doesn‚Äôt seat too many people so I imagine it would be super packed in the morning.

We went to get a breakfast and it was so lovely. Soup was clean, tasty and generous portion.
Good price and friendly service as well.
I have saved this place on the map for next visit when i come back to Saigon.

We had bun Thanh and bun moc with 2 bottle of herbal tea for breakfast. It was delicious and delightful.
Recommend people who want to have not too heavy breakfast. And for people who is not good with cilantro and coriander, you can request them not to put in.
The service can speak English as well and it was really kind and thoughtful of him to explain to us everything.
Great clean little spot for breakfast or lunch. The Bun Thang was legit tasty and the broth was super clean and fresh with a great balance of salty and slightly sweet. Would 100% recommend

B√∫n Thang Chi Ba is run by a very kind family. The Bun Cha Gio was wonderful. It was topped with so many herbs and peanuts. And the gio came out super fresh. I only have a few days left in Saigon, but I'm definitely planning on coming back to try some more of their street food!

serving up a local northern dish, the Bun Thang, is a bowl of rice noodles topped with an assortment of ingredients. i guess you could kinda call it like a viet noodle soup 'bimbimbap' - clearly each country has their own version of similar dishes

the broth is tasty and clean, topped with nice rich ingredients.
definitely a healthy eat!

Follow @bredgyeats for more food pics!

Served bubbling hot in a stone bowl, this deeply beefy broth with an aromatic lemongrass undertone that clings beautifully to the chewy rice noodles, served with the tender beef ribs that easily fell off the bone, with a robust beefiness, along with the bouncy beef balls. However, the toppings don't stop, the crab meatballs have a subtle seafood sweetness, plus the slices of brisket, rare beef and snappy tendons. Its neutral beef flavour is heightened with your choice of condiments, from a classic fish sauce, chili salt, or fermented fish sauce to elevate your bite. They'll bring a serving of Vietnamese yogurt unprompted, renowned for its silky smooth and light mouthfeel, with a more pronounced tang and sweetness than what I know in the West. Just remember, you'll have to pay for it.

0x31752fd48d869ff5:0x92de7f536bf58948.comment:
**B√∫n Qu·∫≠y** is a unique and flavorful noodle dish originating from Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc Island in Vietnam. What sets it apart from other noodle soups is the way it‚Äôs prepared and served. The name "qu·∫≠y" means "stirring," referring to the interactive dining experience where diners mix their own ingredients into the broth.

The dish typically consists of fresh rice noodles served in a light, clear broth, accompanied by freshly ground seafood such as shrimp, fish paste, and squid. The process begins with the customer stirring these ingredients into the hot broth at the table, allowing the flavors to meld together. The broth, though simple, becomes rich and flavorful as the seafood cooks and releases its essence.

A key element of **B√∫n Qu·∫≠y** is the spicy dipping sauce, made from fish sauce, chili, lime, sugar, and sometimes fresh herbs. Diners often add this sauce to the bowl to adjust the flavor to their liking, making each bite customizable. The dish is light, fresh, and perfect for seafood lovers seeking an authentic and interactive Vietnamese culinary experience.

**B√∫n Qu·∫≠y** has gained popularity beyond Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc, thanks to its fresh ingredients, DIY preparation, and distinctive flavors.

Never knew this kind of noodle existed until my friend introduced it to me.
Gotta say it's pretty tasty and fresh. Gotta follow their instruction how to eat it. Mix half of the dipping sauce given to you into the soup. Then just taste the broth to see if it's up to your kind of saltiness and flavor.
I personally don't like the beef. It's chewy to me. The fish and shrimp is not a piece of meat it's like a paste thing. It's pretty good and soft.
Overall, I enjoy this noodle style and will come back again.

The constant buzz of customers is a testament to how good this eatery is. The dish itself is simple: clear, light broth that might not be for those who crave bolder flavours.

I personally love the option with two types of toppings, ground filleted fish and prawn. Once my bowl arrives, I customise it to perfection: a sprinkle of black pepper, a handful of fresh veggies, and a scoop of their signature kumquat chilli salt. And with each bite of noodles, I add a touch of their unique sauce for an extra flavour boost.

The service is speedy and efficient, but due to the popularity, sometimes sharing a table with friendly strangers is also a part of the experience.

The sauce is the bomb!

One of the best street food meals in Saigon. Despite being so packed inside and out, the staff managed to take our orders real fast and accurately. Food came to the table pretty quickly as well. Fresh seafood and the noodles were freshly made. The sauce, damn - It‚Äôs the sauce that made the broth texture rich and tasty.

Amazing B√∫n Qu·∫≠y - loved it so much I went 3 times!  The sauce is on the side and the instructions on the wall - add pepper, add half a tablespoon of the sauce to the dish to mix, then add a bit of sauce to every mouthful. If you're every ordering in Vietnam, look for "Dac Biet" on the menu - it literally means special or gimme a bit of everything.  Highly recommended!!  If you're going for lunch remember they close at 1:30 to prep for the evening.
First time to have this kind of Phu Quoc bun. The crab cake thing was special with that sauce. Soup was okay. You can try it but don‚Äôt expect too much.

0x31752f1d429db6a9:0x6dbe63a2c1e7366e.comment:
decent Bun Ca Nha Trang dish
they got it with Sua (Jellyfish) and Muc Sua (baby squid) too!

theres a few outdoor seating areas but also plenty indoors with the aircon on!
it can get quite busy however no need to book
its definitely popular amongst the locals here

it also sits on a big intersection too so its hard to miss!

One of our flavourite dish to have , the fish noodle of course. The soupy fish noodle was delicious for light dinner. But the after thirsty feeling was not pleasant indeed. Those who are sensitive with MSG may take note with. Over all was a good meal to have. Just avoid the nem nuong. Not a good selection for the price  and taste. I personally will not reorder it from this shop.

Delicious food, by the time we left the restaurant it was full house so you know how popular this restaurant is. We had 2 kinds of noodles and the squid salad, the squid salad with rice paper is surprisingly good with the sauces and remember to add the shallots too!! The jelly fish was very crunchy but didn‚Äôt taste much, squid was much better.

Delicious fish soup with squid, jellyfish, grilled and fresh fish. They got a menu translated in English for most items. You can put seasoning the soup broth to your taste, be aware of the core bone of the squid that you shouldn‚Äôt eat. Very clean place and fast service. Overall everything is good with good value for money. Maybe wish the staff were a bit more friendly.

Tasty and delicious fish noodle from Nha Trang. Not so crowded, there have indoor seat as well with air condition. But sitting outside is more fun than indoor. This place is very good care and good  hygiene as well, you will not step any oily floor and bone or food waste on the floor. The staff is well trained and friendly as well. They explained to customers what they have selling. If you can speak Vietnamese then it sure be no issue for you to asking.

Very busy, you may have to sit on the street. But the jellyfish squid salad is yummy. The Nha Trang grilled pork DIY rolls are delicious. If you are in Vietnam and want to try other food apart from Pho and Banh Mi then this is a good place to start.

Cravings some noodles soup in Vietnam?
Our driver recommended this place. One of their popular dishes called Mi Quang Thap Cam that serves egg noodles with seafood. It was really delicious with the veggies they have on the side. They have sauce that you add into the broth too so don‚Äôt forget to add those. The broth was very flavorful with the peanuts that they added. They give quite good amount of seafood and quail eggs.

Be careful if you‚Äôre allergic to peanuts. Be careful because they charge for each wet wipes you take. They also serve Nem Nuong but they only serve it later in the afternoon. The lady suggested to break black sesame chips in the soup and eat it together. She doesn‚Äôt speak English at all but she‚Äôs super friendly and still will serve you. Many local come by to eat all the time so come check it out!

Very delcious Central VN food.
Price is very customer friendly.
Always crowded.
Freshly made Vietnamese seafood from the sea.

0x31752f347770228b:0x5787a61fe0bf3aba.comment:
Tous les Jours is a chain so they have quite a few outlets which is great. The place looks nice as it has a buffet style layout. I ordered from the establishment a total of 2 times before I stopped going there.

The first time I ate there, I had 2 buns and an iced coffee. The buns tasted nice but had gone cold as they were left exposed to the air conditioning. The iced coffee was good and they served it to my table.

The second time I went there, I ordered take away as I was on the way to work and wanted a quick breakfast. The cashier at the counter didn‚Äôt have gloves on and was sticking her hand into the plastic to put the bun in. Later, when she was taking payment, she used the same hand to handle the cash and cash register. Absolutely horrifying. If I was ordering food from a street vendor, I would accept it. However, since this is an established chain that is charging a premium, basic hygiene is expected from the staff.

That was the last time I visited Tous Les Jours as if the staff were this unhygienic in front of the customers, I can‚Äôt imagine what goes on in the kitchen. Anyways, the buns are quite underwhelming as they‚Äôre left sitting out in the cold since morning.

Tous Les Jours offers fresh and delicious baked goods every day. The bread is soft and flavorful, with a nice variety of pastries and cakes. The caf√© is clean and cozy, and the staff are friendly and helpful. Great place for a quick snack or coffee break!

Looking for a unique spot that combines the best of both worlds? This bakery/cafe 2-in-1 offers a cozy, inviting atmosphere where you can enjoy freshly baked bread paired with delicious caf√© treats. While it‚Äôs a little on the pricier side, the quality and taste are unmatched. From soft, artisanal loaves to perfectly brewed coffee, every bite is crafted with care. Whether you're stopping in for a quick snack or relaxing with friends, this bakery caf√© is the perfect place to indulge in top-notch flavors. Treat yourself to the best bread and caf√© experience today!

This patisserie/coffee shop is all around HCMC. They have a wide assortment of deliciousness (cakes, pastries, drinks, coffees, etc). Everything I tried in 2 weeks was super fresh. My absolute favourite was the red bean buns. They were pillowy soft and the filling was smooth and not overly sweet. Super affordable if you want a quiet and clean place to sit down and recharge or start your morning here.

It's a French bakery with so much delicious food it's difficult to choose! We came for breakfast and I ordered a coffee to go with it. This was the point it went downhill as I waited about 20 mins for the coffee to be made. The drinks orders go straight to a separate area from the till, but  with online orders coming in for uber collections they get pushed down the queue so it takes ages! We chased the drinks up twice before they finally arrived! I'd suggest ordering drinks immediately you arrive before then choosing what to eat and it might work better!
We came back 2 days later for a take-away pastry to be heated up. Again, the few minutes they said it would be became about 15, but the pastry was delicious! You just need patience here üòÜ

The manager talks so loud and that really affects the vibes & mood of the space. Other things are good, good cakes good price. My favorite place to work and hangout with my pilates friends.

Lovely selection of interesting pastries, both sweet and savory, with a range of flavours. We tried the cheesy focaccia and matcha bun. As with all Vietnamese savory pastries the focaccia was a bit sweeter than traditional pastries but delicious all the same.

0x3174c10000c64f89:0x46f0677519b7f9c5.comment: Today I bought the Dubai chocolate cake and it was so tasty I forgot to take a photo I ate it so quickly. The cake was light fluffy and soft the chocolate so tasty and the girl serving customers is always so sweet. Very tasty! Probably the best cake I've tasted from a local bakery in HCM thus far!

BUYERS BEWARE. I ordered via Grab from Choco Bakery and had a very disappointing experience. The store accepted my order, then messaged to say the item was out of stock and insisted I must choose something else. I politely declined and asked to cancel, but they tried to push me to change the order ‚Äúto help the store‚Äù ‚Äî which was a very strange request.

I asked again to cancel, but they said it was not possible. I tried again and they stated that it was now too late because the driver had arrived. The driver also messaged, saying the owner wanted me to choose something else. Before I could even respond, they packed a different item without my consent and sent it out.

I tried the replacement, but it wasn‚Äôt good at all and the whole thing ended up in the bin. Very disappointed overall. I won‚Äôt be ordering from here again. Night ruined.

UPDATE:
Store has tried to report me to Grab so I have attached the conversation as evidence. The food may be great here, I just had a bad experience.

I didn't receive a photo of the replacement and as I had no choice I had requested something sweet as a last minute decision. The driver said when he arrived they already had something packed, however it was not sweet.

0x31752fcb051be2cd:0x2c823b361ddf3c53.comment: We finally visited Ivoire for breakfast after passing by many times and often taking away their p√¢tisseries. Our favorite remains the caviar tiramisu. This time we had the pain au chocolat, cinnamon roll, and pain suisse with chocolate & pistachio, plus an espresso and a lychee rose iced tea. Everything was absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. The staff were wonderful, friendly, and always smiling. Prices are slightly on the higher side for Saigon, but the quality more than justifies it ‚Äî still very good value for money. A refined little patisserie in Saigon, well worth a visit!

Ivoire is where pastry meets poetry ‚Äî a place that turns butter, sugar, and patience into quiet art. Each creation feels deliberate yet effortless: croissants that flake like morning light, tarts that glow with freshness, and cakes that balance refinement with emotion.

What makes Ivoire unforgettable is its curiosity ‚Äî the way French technique embraces local soul. You might find a pandan croissant, a persimmon cake that tastes like autumn, or the cheeky B∆†nana pudding printed with eatable ink. Every season brings a new surprise, yet the spirit stays the same: graceful, modern, and deeply personal.

At Ivoire, innovation never overshadows warmth ‚Äî it simply reminds you that even perfection can evolve.

A perfect cozy spot in District 1 to escape a rainy day. ‚òîüç∞ The cakes are beautifully presented, fresh, and come in unique flavors.

Prices are around 220k VND for a small cake: a bit pricey, but considering the central location, good taste, and attentive service, it feels fair. Worth a visit if it fits your budget.

I love the AVOCADO ü§©

It was so hard to decide what to get because everything looked so beautiful. We went with the pandan coconut croissant, coffee pecan croissant and Black Forest cake. All were great but the croissants were perfect. Crunchy and flaky on the outside with a delicious creamy filling.

The staff were also very friendly and always smiling. They even walked me to my grab with an umbrella when it was pouring down rain outside, thank you!

The cakes were all super duper pretty. Pretty pricey but that‚Äôs for a reason for sure - the components of the cakes were interesting and unique, something that you can‚Äôt really find elsewhere. Really enjoyed the Avocado cake. The staffs were super friendly too :)

Beautiful pastry boutique in the heart of Saigon! The cakes and croissants are both stunning and delicious, especially the Tiramisu Caviar and Coffee Pecan Croissant. Friendly staff and elegant atmosphere ‚Äî a must-visit for dessert lovers.

The cinnamon roll was delicious, perfectly balanced in sweetness and flavor, not overwhelming at all. The owners clearly put effort into maintaining the place, especially the toilet, which was spotless and well equipped with amenities like hand towels and female sanitary kits.

Has to be the best patisserie in Saigon. We visited back in June and for the 5 days of our stay, we went to Ivoire every day. All the patisserie were very neatly decorated. Many are in trompe l‚Äôoeil style. The pastries are very nice as well but their patisserie is a do not miss. They have not many tables but the turnover is ok, we always manage to get the table.

0x317528cd75edad03:0xaa585916800955ba.comment: Such a well decorated and pretty bakery in a French styled mansion. And their cakes is as good as it looks. The croissant with avocado cream is surprisingly delicious with a cold filling and warm and flaky dough. Shijuso is a mix between Japanese cheesecake and sponge cake, which is delightful to eat. I'm a little bit disappointed with tiramisu because mille crepe as the base makes it not as interesting as soaked ladyfingers even though it has good and strong cocoa and espresso flavor. Service is top tier. Matcha and hojicha beverages are as good as expected.

I have ordered many times from The Vagabond on either Grab and Be app, and most of them are very good. The dishes I ordered are mostly baked dishes, then entremet dishes and I am very satisfied with the perfection, the sophistication in every detail and especially in the texture and filling of the cake. Everything is perfectly balanced. What I like most about the baked croissants is that they use a type of butter that rarely gains weight, and the taste is very delicious along with the perfect texture of each layer of cake and a lot of filling. This is a commendable point. For the entremet dishes, I am very satisfied with the story of each cake and the health benefits of each layer of filling in the entremet. This is not only delicious, beautiful but also very attentive to the health of consumers, this is the heart of the baker that I rarely see in other bakeries. I rarely eat cakes but the story of The Vagabond has attracted me. October is coming, a special day, and I think I have chosen a perfect place to celebrate now. Thank you, The Vagabond and wish you all the best!

Delicious pastries, especially the croissants, as well as ice coffees.

Our room was the plainer one but had excellent air conditioning.

Tried to have the special combo offer for 4 people but the layered crepe cakes were too tempting!

The entrance is quite hidden, accidentally went to the Japanese store beside instead. but we came out.
Ordered 3 different pastry. Mirage is nice, but Shijuso and the Tiramisu is below average.
However, they have a very nice vibe and it‚Äôs a good place to chill and talk.

10 points for Vagabond!!!! Such a lovely serene place, delicious pastries and drinks. Highly recommend the avocado croissant and salted caramel coffee. Above all, the service was impeccable. I accidentally spilt my drink and not only were they happy to help clean up, they brought out a replacement drink without me asking. They truly went above and beyond. Thanks!!!

A great cafe to study or small talk with friends. The drinks here are okay but doesn't leave such big impact, the pastry on the other hand is top notch, highly recommend you trying either the tiramisu croissants or avocado croissants.

Good atmosphere. The tea was good but drinks consist of a lot of ice cubes.

Croissant was kind of disappointing too. The avocado cream was not a cream but instead very frozen as if it was ice cream. The avocado taste was very light. Could not taste it really. Hope they can improve on it.

Value doesn‚Äôt match the price.

I received very patient service here, reading the menu often takes some time for foreigners keen to explore, but the waiter was very patient and waited and gave advice. The espresso and tiramisu were both very good, and their tiramisu was unique, with a good balance of bitterness and sweetness.

0x31752fc24d40e03d:0xc54c427583676305.comment: Nestled in a bustling alley, Robin Mouquet‚Äôs pastry shop is a hidden gem. The quality of their pastries is simply exceptional, and you‚Äôll never go back to those generic chain bakeries again. One sunny Sunday morning, we had the pleasure of watching them create their magic in the shop. It was a delightful experience, and the aroma and taste transported us straight to the streets of Paris. Well done, Robin! üòäüëçüèº
The best croissant I ever tried in Veitnam. You can't go wrong with any choice. Too bad, I can't try all kinds. Definitely gotta come back to try all selections.

Pastry shop is in District 10, once you go in you feel that fresh baking smell. As I am a big fan of pistachio, I take pistachio croissant and hot cappuccino. So good with crunch/butter and generous amount of pistachio cream. You feel that people here really like what they do and that is so important! Kind and nice staff. I will visit them again!
Recommended!!!

Spending the afternoon with Robin Mouquet, the ‚Äúpied piper of pastry‚Äù in his quaint bakery in Quan 10 over which he lives.
‚Ä¢ We talked about his journey to Vietnam via Michelin starred kitchen in Paris and Shanghai, his love of the curiosity of the Vietnamese people, his energetic local team of ten and he also explained some of the dark arts of bakery like managing humidity.
‚Ä¢ His iconic mille feuille is especially worthy of a trip, deliciously crunchy and gorgeously gooey and I love his range of indulgent iced tea‚Äôs ordering the green tea and citrus expression

Traveled 50km just for this!!

Read about on social media for a while until we finally got a chance to be here. Wonderful, just wonderful.
. The staff is lovely and helpful
. The food is nice. We enjoyed every bites
Great work guys. See u soon

We ordered a tiramisu for 3-4 people, it was smaller than I expected, and the outside was a bit different than in the photo. The coffee and chocolate tasted good, but the inside was kinda watery. Overall not too bad for our first tasting. Definitely should try the one person size.

FYI location on the map is not updated - they‚Äôve moved to inside Sofitel Saigon Plaza at a small booth in the lobby, which you can takeaway or eat-in at the hotel lounge. I had the almond croissant to-go and it was top tier!

For me the best French bakery in Ho Chi Minh ! Love the Croissant & Macarons.
They are using highest quality ingredients. Thanks to the Chef Mouquet and his team

0x31752f3e4c189381:0xdf5b7cebb79e9383.comment:
My food rating guide:
2.5/5 ‚Äê-------> Average taste
5/5 ‚Äê--------> Scrumptious! (My comfort food! ü§©)

Chocolate donut was nice.

Sausage bun with cheese and ham sandwich were below par. The bun was not soft and the sandwich was quite tough. The sausage was tough. The ham was fine.

Ice coffee was mediocre and a tad sour.

The meal was a 2.3/5

Excellent bakery! A perfect place for a heavy breakfast with lots of buns and pastries on offer. I was spoiled for choice that‚Äôs for sure. The staff spoke basic and limited English but that is acceptable. Prices might be steep for budget backpackers as my friend that went with me is one of them but for a mid range budget I had no issue. There is seating on the second floor and the toilet was clean. Plugs at every seat outlet and it was comfortable enough. Will come back again.

Excellent bakery in the middle of Saigon. It‚Äôs ideal for carb heavy breakfast! ü•∞

Prices are a bit higher than on the streets, but it‚Äôs still affordable and it‚Äôs an aircon place with two floors and proper seating areas.

They also serve drinks there.

TOUS les JOURS has become one of my favorite bakeries in Vietnam. I first tried them in Hanoi and was excited to see multiple locations across Ho Chi Minh City as well. They offer a variety of beautifully crafted pastries, from their signature ribbon pies to the soft and flaky 32 layered tissue bread available in plain and matcha. Everything is well presented and feels fresh from the oven.

They also have a great selection of cakes, both classic and creative, I spotted fruit topped sponges, chocolate ganache, and even a fun bear-shaped cake in the display fridge. It‚Äôs hard not to be impressed by the visual appeal. Whether you‚Äôre after something sweet or savory, you‚Äôll likely find something that suits your mood.

The atmosphere is modern and inviting, with an upstairs seating area that‚Äôs quiet and comfortable, perfect for relaxing with a coffee and pastry. Staff were friendly, and despite the steady flow of customers, service was efficient.

I love starting my day with one of their buttery croissants or a jumbo ribbon pie, paired with a coffee. This bakery is definitely worth visiting if you‚Äôre in town and enjoy quality baked goods.

Tous Les Jours in HCMC is a charming bakery and caf√© offering a wide variety of fresh breads, pastries, and a good selection of local and Italian-style coffees and teas. The quality is consistently good ‚Äî though the bread can be a little too sweet for my taste. Drinks are decent, and the overall vibe is relaxed and inviting. The staff are friendly and polite, and the music adds a nice touch to the cozy atmosphere. I especially appreciate the ample seating available on the first floor, making it a comfortable spot to unwind or catch up with friends.

This bakery is a hidden gem, perfect for anyone craving delicious treats with a unique twist! It opens early at 6:30 AM, making it an ideal spot to grab a coffee and a pastry to start your day. The upstairs seating area really enhances the experience‚Äîit‚Äôs cozy and offers a great view of the bustling traffic below, making it a nice spot to relax and watch the world go by. The menu is extensive, almost overwhelming, but there‚Äôs definitely something for everyone to enjoy. While the coffee and tea menu is limited, the quality of the treats more than makes up for it. We had a wonderful time here, and it was especially a hit with our kids. A lovely, casual hangout with standout items that will keep us coming back!

Wauw, wauw, wauw. This was so delicous! You walk into a heaven of sweet, which is also very cheap. Here you grab a plate and just put everything on it you like. We both chose 3 things per person and it only costs like 8 euros in total. All the things we tried were so good and so delicious. We ate so much that we didn't need to eat anything else that day until late in the evening. It is the best place to eat breakfast!

This bakery is a hidden gem for anyone looking for delicious treats with a unique twist! The twist bun was a standout, perfectly soft with just the right amount of flavor that keeps you coming back for more. The blueberry cheesecake was creamy, rich, and had a delightful balance of sweetness and tanginess. However, the croissant fell a bit short‚Äîit was decent. Still, it‚Äôs worth a visit. Opens early by 6:00. The overall experience was saved by the comfortable upstairs seating area. It‚Äôs a cozy spot to relax and enjoy a treat or two. A lovely find for a casual hangout with standout items!

0x31752f22eefe1477:0x882a223aa6c2325f.comment:
It‚Äôs a bakery stores and it is a Korean franchise. You will find out that this is quite popular.

Their cake and bread items are quite expensive but with good quality for you to consume.

I like how they setup the store, which is cleaned and tidy.

Very fancy packaging, takes long
Sometimes you just want them to take your 6 croissants, shove them in a paper bag and off you go.

They make good coffee, ok for a quick breakfast.
The best bakery and the largest sortiment of breads, croissants and more we have seen in vietnam so far. Within 3 days, we went there twice!

It's rather spacious considering the busy street and the neighborhood. 2 stories with plenty of seats to choose from. Pastries are lovely with various kinds and flavors along with numerous beverages. Bathroom is clean and neat, responsive staff doing a decent job! Parking is at the front with a security guard.

Tous Les Jours offers a delightful bakery experience that combines fresh flavors with a unique and inviting atmosphere. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted by the rich aroma of freshly-baked pastries and breads, all presented with care and attention to detail. Each item is flavorful and satisfying, reflecting the bakery‚Äôs emphasis on quality ingredients and traditional techniques.

The interior design is particularly noteworthy. With a touch of medieval charm blended into a more modern layout, the space feels both elegant and comfortable. It creates a distinctive environment that‚Äôs perfect for casual visits or relaxing with a warm drink.

The service is consistently pleasant, with friendly staff who are welcoming and quick to assist. Their polite demeanor enhances the overall experience and adds a personal touch to each visit.

However, one noticeable drawback is the cleanliness of the dining area. On several occasions, floors and tables appeared unclean or poorly maintained, which detracts from the otherwise polished impression of the store.

In conclusion, Tous Les Jours stands out for its delicious baked goods, charming atmosphere, and kind service. With improved attention to cleanliness, it could truly offer an exceptional experience from start to finish.
Taste of excellence among so many other fine food options. Enjoy a baked good with cafe sua da/nong.

I havent been here for awhile, i have to say, it is actually pretty good, the pastry i had was very crispy outside and soft inside, the meat is tasty and the lychee tea, good, cheapest in the menu but way better than i think.
It is a good stop for bakery and snacks, quality and fresh food. Many people come to buy and take away, very few people sit at the shop.
The decoration and the vibemakes you feel clean, cozy and also tasty too.
Delicious sweets but not cheap. Well worth for the quality you get. They got cakes, tarts, and many other things.

0x31752f74287f2e57:0xeb0e77be4225ea22.comment: Stupendous drinks and a large variety of sweet little treats including marshmallows, cookies, brownies, and cakes. The matcha late with oat milk was awesome - I could have drank a liter of it. The first floor is a little sparse but they have a small, leafy patio and there‚Äôs a second floor with more seating. Space for motorbike parking in front. Highly recommended!

This place has great Thai Tea that‚Äôs worth trying. The design inside is unique and interesting, but not so comfy to spend a good amount of time. Cookie here is very popular and you want to make an order in advance since it‚Äôs usually sold out, but i didn‚Äôt find them to be that great... I liked their almond cookie best thoughüëç

favorite place for their tasty marshmellow! highly rcm chocomellow as well.
for drinks it‚Äôs a bit pricy for their taste, we ordered cinnamon coffee, thai milk tea and lemon tea but all are quite normal. but their cakes and marshmellows are exceptional!
an instagram-worthy place also, cute decoration!
Small and cozy coffeeshop with lots of sweet treats. Staff are super friendly

IF I COILD GIVE THIS PLACE AN 10000/10 I WOULD! The drinks are amazing and the service is wonderful. I highly recommend the red velvet cheesecake, the Thai tea with panacotta, matcha latte, and the pomelo tea. The wondrous selection of marshmallows and cookies are also amazing and the jars are very aesthetic! The staff is very kind and helpful and they take good care of the clean and cute environment! Would come back again! Also the message wall is very magnificent!
The place looks cute. It's filled with sweet aroma from butter and dough, which is really nice. Cookies are great but the marshmallows are even better. Calming place to have some sweet time.
Yummy treats!! I especially liked the chocomallows :)

Great desert place, highly recommend. The brownies are one of the best ones I have ever tried before. The marshmallows are very good, extremely fresh since all are normally made new daily. The tastes are outstanding for the average sweet places and the drinks are also quite decent, not too sweet. Although, the store has only a few tables so take aways is more recommended.

0x31752921afb40763:0x8386cc39cda734c0.comment:
The shop is quite small, so taking away is definitely the best option. Their cakes are really good, fresh, and affordable, no wonder it‚Äôs one of the most popular and best-selling cake shops around! The staff are very friendly and always give customers a warm welcome, which makes the place feel cozy even though it‚Äôs small.

The cakes are soft, moist, and not too sweet, just the right balance of flavor. The strawberries on top are always fresh and add a nice touch to the presentation. If you love delicious, freshly made cakes at a reasonable price, this place is absolutely worth a visit!

A tiny but super popular bakery in District 1 made us curious enough to grab some treats to bring home (note: no seating inside). The staff and security were very friendly, and I loved that they offered samples before buying.

The matcha cake was my favorite: creamy, balanced, and not overly sweet. I also tried the pomelo cake and it was decent, though not particularly special to me.

Price: 90k/ small cake and 180-280k/ bigger size

First impression to the shop, it quite small so I recommend to take away.
They just sell the mousse here for 80.000VND/pc. The cake was outstanding for its flavor (creamy but not sugary) which I prefer what should have in a dessert.
The tiramisu flavor is the king of them. Beside I also try the melon, very light and smooth.
Hope they open first store in Hanoi soon.

Tasty desserts, the staffs were welcoming & helpful. Prices are pretty much in the higher end but the quality is on point since they don't use cheap ingredients & you'd get a much better deal buying in sets.
Store is more of a pickup/grab & go model with a few seats. The cakes were beautifully displayed & the place had a nice vibe to it.
I was taken here by a friend to buy cakes. The fresh fruit-flavored cakes are quite unique and refreshing, but the taste is just average‚Äînot extraordinary. It‚Äôs not really value for money.

I came here to try the fruit tart cake, but unfortunately, they didn't have it. If you want to try their tart cake, you'll need to visit their Xuan Thuy, Thao Dien store, as it's exclusive there.

So, I decided to try the tiramisu gold version instead, and I actually loved it. It's way better than any other tiramisu I've ever tried‚Äînot too sweet, not too rich, and the cream is very well-balanced.

I also tried some other fruit cakes, but while the best thing about them is that they're less sugary and not overly sweet, the taste was just average.

If you're looking for something special, the tiramisu gold version is definitely the highlight here.

Had tiramisu.  Excellent taste.  Served with some jasmine tea.  Staff are wonderful and very friendly.   Great shop.  It's worth the price.

Highly recommended.

Note to owners- could improve seating for those who want to eat in the store

It is really less sugar, as it is not too sweet, but flavor is quite bland. Tried the longan in store and it is missing longan taste. Tiramisu is one of the better flavor but still not enough coffee  and alcohol taste. Chocolate mint is disappointing. Guava berry is better than blueberry. Not worth the price.

0x317525cbec9e8fc7:0x8d39aa0c4139275.comment:
This cute little bakery is a hidden gem with an irresistible charm. The display is always full of beautifully crafted cakes in a wide variety of flavors. Each bite is rich, moist, and clearly made with love. The staff are friendly and happy to make recommendations. It's the perfect spot to treat yourself or grab a sweet gift for someone special.

Love it. Will come back!

I barely leave any review but Muicake is exceptional. I‚Äôm super picky when it comes to sweets. I like them light and not too sugary. Mui Cake totally nailed it! I tried the Tiramisu and OMG‚Ä¶ so soft, creamy, and perfectly balanced.

This cute little place is hidden in an alley and the staff here are so cute and they speak English too. It was easy to order and arrange shipping. Ordered the Choco Strawberry and wow üëå the fridge is always full of their amazing selection and always fresh. Their cakes move fast so you can rest assured its always fresh! They are also reasonable with their prices! They have different sizes and options so they cater to every occasion!

I was looking for a cake to offer to my family who was hosting me. I fell upon this shop online and decided to go. The girls were very sweet, kind and helpful. They had many size cake + prices are good. The cake tasted AMAZING! Very light and flavourful. I would highly recommend üéÇ
great sizes and this place is very clean and pretty. They have a wide variety of cakes to choose from and they were very friendly to us
Such a cute and local pastry shop with lovely staff!

0x31752f02a23486d5:0x50a9e8470f348129.comment: Sometimes you stumble on a business which just nails it, Teos bakery or ABC bakery is ones of those places. We wandered in and had a look and were impressed with the cleanliness, the extensive variety of pastries, cakes etc, and the eatery which is on the left side of the bakery. We decide to grab a bite to eat and a cold iced tea each and WOW, were we impressed, extremely happy with the dishes served, the attentive staff and service. Prices were good, food was quality and tasty. Couldn't been happier. Highly recommend this establishment for locals and especially for foreigners. Thanks Teo for being a place where I can trust the food to be of high quality. And thanks to the staff who were all helpful and pleasant to interact with.
Has in my eyes also cantonese styled baked goods.  It was very yummy, big variety.

Woah this bakery is huge and I had a hard time picking out what I want because I wanted to try them all. I like the salty egg with pork floss bread the most but everything we selected was good.
Even though the shop is huge the walking paths were extremly narrow and the shop was packed. No air conditioning.  The workers seemed overwhelmed as well.

Wide selection of occasion cakes and single piece pastries. The phu si cake is very good.

Price ok but no seating.

new rye apple bread taste good. i asked for pumpkin sandwich and they give me old sandwich last two days ago. coconut jelly is rlly refreshing, its in a whole coconut so u can eat the coconut meat after.

Before I start my review I actually want to highlight a few of the ridiculous 1 star ratings that are unfair. I‚Äôve browsed through and realize that many have complained about the quality of the baked goods. Let me break this down for those who are visiting Vietnam so you aren‚Äôt mistaken. Just like in the United States, this shop actually circulates out their old baked goods every 2-3hours. That means if the product isn‚Äôt gone within 2 or 3 hours, they throw it out and make a new batch. However some have complained about the poor quality of the sandwiches and such. That‚Äôs only because they chose the bread at the end of the hour.

Alright, now my review. The first thing I want to highlight, which I didn‚Äôt see much of in the posts. Is the motorbike security. They are an excellent addition to such a clean and fast paced store. They help you get in and out as quickly and politely as possible. Much respect!

The store itself is cramped, with almost no moving space if it‚Äôs lunch time or filled with more than 7 people. The sad part is, the baking team and cashier girls don‚Äôt do such a great job communicating. So it‚Äôs very hectic when there‚Äôs a crowd. The croissants, donuts and variety of cakes are incredible! However, I really wish the Vietnamese populace wasn‚Äôt so disgusting and pushy. I‚Äôve seen a few people touch some bread with their hands then put it back. This frustrates me to no end. They have TONGS for a reason. In any case, A+ for the massive selection and great taste. D grade for a poor group of staff that doesn‚Äôt operate well under pressure.

All in all, I gave this place a 4 star. Because they do an excellent job of providing tasty desserts!

Oh and the moon cakes I bought are only for limited time. So if you‚Äôre reading this review after the festival, it means they no longer have it üòé

Way too busy and they have a really stupid policy that you can't take photos of their products. Went in to buy a birthday cake for someone else but needed a different person to choose from the options they had. Immediately after taking out my phone, I was approached to say I can't take any pictures. Sorry but your designs aren't that nice or unique that anyone is going to steal them. In fact they look like just about any bake shop from the 80s-90s with really cheap decorations. Get over yourselves, you aren't special at all. Also keep in mind that people can take pictures after they buy, so you really aren't accomplishing anything except being rude to your customers that are shopping in your store with this rule.

Super delicious peeling flakes pastry. Unfortunately I was not living in Hochiminh city so I had to ask my friend to buy it for me and send it via the post office. 0x31752efbbe07fca3:0x972a9e1d1067e83f.comment: PB&J Cake  - The cake was decently fluffy and it had a soft slightly bouncy texture. The soft texture was straight from the fridge meaning there was no butter Incorporated into the cake. The sponge cake itself is lightly sweet and somewhat eggy and there is a thin layer of peanut butter and jelly in the center, where the jam was a bit tangy while the peanut butter faded into the background.

My sister and I recently stumbled upon this delightful bakery that I just had to share with everyone. Tucked away in a charming corner, it's incredibly easy to find. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a sense of warmth and comfort. The bakery is impeccably clean, with a bright and inviting atmosphere that instantly puts you at ease.

One thing that immediately caught my eye was the vast array of beautifully crafted pastries on display. From delicate tarts to indulgent cakes, the selection was simply mesmerizing. I couldn't resist picking up a Fuji cake and a rainbow roll cake to enjoy on the spot. And let me tell you, they did not disappoint.

But the real star of the show was the special cake I ordered for the next day. The pandan cake was a revelation ‚Äì soft, fragrant, and infused with the subtle aroma of pandan leaves. While it leaned slightly towards the sweeter side for my taste, the flavor was so rich and nuanced that I found myself savoring every bite. It was unlike anything I had ever tasted before ‚Äì a harmonious blend of flavors and textures that left me speechless. The cake was moist, bursting with flavor, and expertly balanced in sweetness. Each bite was a symphony of taste, and I found myself longing for more long after the last crumb had disappeared.

Considering the quality of the pastries and the reasonable prices, I truly believe this bakery offers exceptional value for money. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dessert experience. Whether you're a connoisseur of sweets or simply looking to satisfy a craving, this place has something for everyone. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

This bakery shop have variety of pastry. All they sell is tasty,fresh, and happiness. For those want to find the traditional pastry I think you should come here and check around. Text could cheating you but photo and the food itself can tell the true
